所有公共EEG数据集的列表。这份脑电图资源清单并不详尽。如果您发现了一些新的东西，或者已经深入研究了任何未过滤的链接，请更新存储库。
左/右手MI：包括52名受试者(38名具有区别性特征的有效受试者)、生理和心理问卷结果、肌电数据集、3D EEG电极位置和非任务相关状态的脑电图。
运动/图像数据集：包括109名志愿者、64个电极、2个基线任务(睁眼和闭眼)、运动运动和运动图像(双拳或双脚)。
抓举脑电图挑战赛：12名受试者，32个通道，500 Hz，共6个抓举项目，即a)。手动启动b)。FirstDigitTouch c)。开始加载阶段d)。发射e)。替换f)。两者都已发布。
运动图像的最大SCP数据：该数据集包含60小时的EEG BCI记录，涉及13名参与者的75个记录会话、60,000个心理图像和4个BCI交互范式，其中包含同一个体的多个记录会话和范式。脑机接口交互涉及多达6个心理意象状态被考虑。[文章]。
脑机接口竞赛IV-1：64个脑电通道，1000 Hz采样率，左手、右手、脚2类(+空闲状态)，7名受试者。评估数据是也包含空闲状态周期的连续EEG。
脑机接口竞赛IV-2a：22个电极的脑电图运动图像数据集，有9个受试者和2个会话，每个受试者有288个4秒的想象动作试验。包括左手、右手、脚和舌头的运动。[数据集描述]。
脑机接口竞赛IV-2b：3电极EEG运动图像数据集，有9个受试者和5个想象左手或右手运动的会话，最新的3个会话包括在线反馈。[数据集描述]
高伽马数据集：128个电极的数据集，来自14个健康受试者，每个受试者有大约1000个4秒的执行动作试验，分为13次。这四类动作分别是左手、右手、双脚和休息的动作。
左/右手1D/2D动作：1个受试者的19个电极数据，1D和2D手部动作的各种组合(实际执行)。
右手拇指动作想象：每次试验都要求受试者休息，记录休息数据5min。此外，当受试者被要求想象右手拇指运动时，也记录了5秒的历时数据。5个想象的运动，并记录每个试验的休息状态。单个受试者，8个电极，256 Hz。
心理表象数据集：13名受试者，超过6万例运动表象，采用38通道医用脑电图系统记录的4个交互范式中的6万多个动作表象。它包含多达6个主要用于运动的心理想象的数据。[文章]。
DAP：包括32个受试者，每个受试者观看1分钟长的音乐视频节选，由用户根据arousal/valence/like-dislike/dominanace/famaliarity，和22/32子视频的正面记录进行评级。
ENTERFACE&#39；06项目07：EEG(64个通道)+fNIRS+FACE视频，包括16个受试者，其中情绪是通过选择的IAPS数据集的子集引起的。
想象的情绪：31名受试者听暗示一种情绪的语音录音，并要求受试者想象一种情绪情景或回忆他们以前感受过这种情绪的经历。
神经营销：25名受试者，14个电极，喜欢/不喜欢的商业电子商务产品超过14类，每类3张图片。数据集的文章：脑电信号的分析及其在神经营销中的应用。[文章]
SEED：向15名受试者播放引发积极/消极/中性情绪的视频剪辑，并记录超过62个通道的脑电图。
SEED-IV：向15名受试者播放快乐/悲伤/中性/恐惧情绪的视频剪辑，并在62个通道上记录脑电图(带有眼球跟踪)，每名受试者3次(每次24次试验)。
SEED-VIG：在模拟驾驶任务中使用脑电数据进行警戒标记。包括18个电极和眼球跟踪。
HCI标记：让受试者观看视频片段(电影片段)，并要求他们在价位和唤醒程度上对情绪状态进行注释。在整个实验过程中，音频、视频、凝视数据和生理数据被同步记录，传感器之间精确同步。
唤醒调节：18名受试者接受三种不同的音频反馈沉默、假的和脑-机接口的在线飞行模拟器研究。[文章]。
BCI-NER挑战：26名受试者，56个脑电通道，用于P300拼写任务，并标记了当P300解码正确或错误字母时引发的反应的数据集。
在目标选择任务中监测ERRP：6名受试者有64个脑电电极，看着光标朝目标方块移动，并根据光标在正确或错误的方向上移动来标记诱发的反应。[数据集描述]。
连续反馈过程中的ERRP：10名受试者28个脑电电极，玩视频游戏研究执行和结果错误。[数据集部件-1][数据集部件-2]
HCI标记：向Subjetc显示图像或电影片段，并在屏幕底部添加标记。在某些情况下，标签正确地描述了一些情况。然而，在其他情况下，标签并不实际应用于媒体项目。在每个项目之后，如果参与者同意适用于媒体项目的标签，则要求他们按绿色按钮，如果不同意，则按红色按钮。在整个实验过程中，音频、视频、凝视数据和生理数据被同步记录，传感器之间精确同步。
C-VEP BCI：9名受试者，32个EEG通道，用于VEP BCI拼写任务(32个字符)，以及针对与拼写相关联的标签所引起的响应的标记数据集。[数据集说明][已发表文章]。
带干电极的C-VEP BCI：9名受试者，15个干EEG通道，用于VEP BCI拼写任务(32个字符)，以及针对与拼写相关联的标签所引起的响应的标记数据集。[文章]。
SSVEP-视觉搜索/辨别和握手：包括3种不同的测试，(I)五盒视觉测试：基于附着力和无人值守的圆盘和正方形刺激，(Ii)自然图像内的视觉搜索：在黑白自然图像中搜索黄点刺激，(Iii)握手测试：显示左手/右手闭合/打开图像。30名受试者，14个电极。[第1条][第2条][更多数据集：数据集2]。
同步脑波数据集：15人被呈现两种不同的视频刺激，包括眨眼、放松、心算、数颜色框和观看超级碗广告。[刺激计划1][刺激计划2]。
图形视觉诱发电位：数据集#5，2名受试者在O1位置记录棋盘光图形(古怪范例)。
面孔VS房屋歧视：7名癫痫患者分别接受了50个灰度刺激，分别用于脸部和房屋图片。对于每个受试者，总共进行了3次实验，产生了300次刺激。
目标与非目标：25名受试者测试大脑入侵者，这是一个使用古怪范式的视觉P300脑机接口。16个电极，湿的。出版物，代码。数据集ID：BI.EEG.2012-GIPSA。
目标与非目标：24名受试者玩大脑入侵者，这是一个使用古怪范式的视觉P300脑机接口。16个电极，湿的。每名受试者最多参加8次会议。两种实验条件：使用黎曼几何进行自适应校准和不使用自适应校准。出版物，代码。数据集ID：BI.EEG.2013-GIPSA。
目标与非目标：71名受试者玩大脑入侵者，这是一种视觉P300脑机接口，使用具有自适应黎曼几何的古怪范式(无校准)。16个电极，干燥。出版物，代码。数据集ID：bi2014a.。
目标与非目标：38名受试者玩多人协作版本的大脑入侵者，这是一个使用具有自适应黎曼几何(无校准)的古怪范式的视觉P300脑机接口。每名受试者32个电极，湿的，每次治疗2名受试者。出版物，代码。数据集ID：bi2014b.。
目标与非目标：50名受试者玩大脑入侵者，这是一种视觉P300脑机接口，使用具有自适应黎曼几何的古怪范式(无校准)。32个电极，湿的。每名受试者3次，并调节闪光持续时间。出版物，代码。数据集ID：bi2015a.。
目标对非目标：44名受试者玩多人(合作和竞争)版本的大脑入侵者，这是一个使用具有自适应黎曼几何(无校准)的古怪范式的视觉P300脑机接口。每名受试者32个电极，湿式，每次2名受试者。出版物，代码。数据集ID：bi2015b.。
阻抗数据：12名受试者接受20%稀有刺激的P300任务(Oddball范式)。总共有128个目标刺激和512个标准刺激。以一种方式收集数据集，使得一次记录包含电极中的不同阻抗。[文章]。
持续注意驾驶：27名被试在VR环境下进行持续注意驾驶，以监测事件相关电位。每个受试者都参加了两次90min的训练(无/无和有动觉反馈)，并用32个通道和500 Hz进行记录。[文章][预处理数据集]。
德莱亚德-言语：5个不同的实验，通过包括听觉、视觉刺激和想象言语在内的各种任务来研究自然言语理解。(I)20世纪中叶一部受欢迎的美国小说的有声读物版本--19名受试者，(Ii)以相同的顺序介绍相同的审判，但28个演讲片段中的每一个都是反向播放的，(Iii)N400实验：受试者阅读300个句子，其中一半以不一致的词结束--(Iv)鸡尾酒会实验：33个受试者进行了30个实验，每个实验60分，其中两个经典小说作品被呈现给他们：一个放在左耳，另一个放在左耳。受试者被分成两组，每组17人和16人(排除对象+1人)，在整个30个试验中，每组人都被指示用左耳或右耳听故事。(V)多感官实验：刺激是从一组视频中提取的，这些视频由一名男性以类似对话的方式说美国英语。[正文][补充条款]
心理表象数据集：13名受试者，超过6万例运动表象，采用38通道医用脑电图系统记录的4个交互范式中的6万多个动作表象。它包含多达6个主要用于运动的心理想象的数据。[文章]。
静息状态脑电图数据：22名受试者，72个脑电通道，进行8min的静息任务，闭眼4min，睁眼4min。[文章]。
EID-M、EID-S：8例静息状态(闭眼)受试者，用EPOC+记录14个电极，记录时间为54s，频率为128 Hz(每电极7000个样本)。EID-M有三个试验，EID-S是一个单一试验数据集。数据集被用来开发一个通过脑电波进行身份识别的系统。[文章]。
SPIS静息状态数据集：10名受试者，64个通道，每种状态(闭眼和睁眼)记录2.5分钟，然后用固定顺序和变化的ISIS持续关注反应任务105分钟。[艺术]。
α波-20名受试者，16个通道，两个触发器(A)闭眼和(B)睁眼的10s样本。标签也可用于疲劳(从1到10)。
音乐图像信息检索：10名受试者，64个脑电通道，完成12个不同节拍、长度和节奏的音乐图像任务。[文章]。
面部感知过程中的非自愿眼动：数据集1，26个电极，500 Hz采样率，120次试验。眼球运动和瞳孔直径记录、EEG和EOG数据是当受试者在屏幕上呈现出高兴/悲伤/愤怒的面孔时出现的。[文章][附注：数据集仅按要求提供]。
自愿-非自愿眨眼：使用g.tec在14个电极上记录20名受试者的自愿眨眼(要求受试者在音频刺激后1s内自愿眨眼)和非自愿眨眼(自然眨眼)。对于每个主题，以.mat格式提供3个会议，每个会议有20个试验。[文章]
EEG-EY STATE：带有闭眼和睁眼标签的一次连续记录117秒的EEG的眼睛状态标签数据。该数据集是从Emotiv耳机记录的。
EEG-IO：使用OpenBCI设备和Biopac Cap100C记录20例受试者的自愿性单眼眨眼(给予外部刺激)和额部电极(FP1、FP2)的脑电图。进行了一次会议，每个受试者大约25次眨眼。手动注释是使用视频馈送完成的。[文章]。
EEG-VV、EEG-VR：使用OpenBCI设备和Biopac Cap100C记录12例受试者的非自主眨眼(自然眨眼)和额部电极(FP1、FP2)的脑电图。受试者进行了两项活动--观看视频(EEG-VV)和阅读文章(EEG-VR)。手动注释是使用视频馈送完成的。[文章]。
眼睛状态预测：通过使用EPOC耳机(14个电极)记录标记的眼睛状态数据(打开和关闭)，117秒记录单个受试者。[文章]。
KARA-ONE：想象和发声的音素和单字提示，以获取语言和语音产品。14名受试者使用64通道神经扫描Quick-cap进行记录，同时进行面部跟踪和音频。[文章]。
MNIST大脑数字：当一个数字(0-9)被显示给受试者时的脑电图数据，使用Minwave、EPOC、Muse、Insight为单个受试者记录2秒。包括超过120万个样品。
ImageNet Brain：显示随机图像(来自Imagenet ILSVRC2013列车数据集中的14k个图像)，并为一个受试者记录3s的EEG信号。包括超过70K个样本。
工作记忆：参与者短暂观察一个包含多个英文字符集(500ms)的数组，并将信息保持3秒。然后呈现测试字符，如果测试宪章与集合中的一个字符匹配，则参与者通过按下按钮来响应。15名学生，64个电极，500 Hz采样率。只有一小部分数据是公开的。[原文][ICLR的进一步分析]
深度睡眠慢振荡：在慢振荡结束前10秒开始录制的10秒。记录数据的目的是预测在假条件下，即没有任何刺激的情况下，慢振荡之后是否会有另一慢振荡。
酒精中毒的遗传易感性：对120名受试者进行120次试验，记录在256 Hz的64个电信号上。考虑了两组受试者，酗酒者和对照组。文中给出了具体的刺激方案。
MOOC期间的困惑：10名学生观看MOOC视频，分为两类-令人困惑的(如基础数学)和不令人困惑的(如量子理论)。时长2分钟，每个类别10个视频。通过正面通道的单通道无线心态录制。[文章]。

note_en:
A list of all public EEG-datasets. This list of EEG-resources is not exhaustive. If you find something new, or have explored any unfiltered link in depth, please update the repository.
 Left/Right Hand MI: Includes 52 subjects (38 validated subjects with discriminative features), results of physiological and psychological questionnares, EMG Datasets, location of 3D EEG electrodes, and EEGs for non-task related states
 Motor Movement/Imagery Dataset: Includes 109 volunteers, 64 electrodes, 2 baseline tasks (eye-open and eye-closed), motor movement, and motor imagery (both fists or both feet)
 Grasp and Lift EEG Challenge: 12 subjects, 32channels@500Hz, for 6 grasp and lift events, namely a). HandStart b). FirstDigitTouch c). BothStartLoadPhase d). LiftOff e). Replace f). BothReleased
 The largest SCP data of Motor-Imagery: The dataset contains 60 hours of EEG BCI recordings across 75 recording sessions of 13 participants, 60,000 mental imageries, and 4 BCI interaction paradigms, with multiple recording sessions and paradigms of the same individuals. BCI interactions involving up to 6 mental imagery states are considered.  [Article]
 BCI Competition IV-1: 64 EEG channels at 1000Hz sampling rate for 2 classes of left hand, right hand, foot (+ idle state) for 7 subjects. Evaluation data is continuous EEG which contains also periods of idle state.
 BCI Competition IV-2a: 22-electrode EEG motor-imagery dataset, with 9 subjects and 2 sessions, each with 288 four-second trials of imagined movements per subject. Includes movements of the left hand,the right hand, the feet and the tongue.  [Dataset Description]
 BCI Competition IV-2b: 3-electrode EEG motor-imagery dataset with 9 subjects and 5 sessions of imagined movements of the left or the right hand, the latest 3 sessions include online feedback.  [Dataset Description]
 High-Gamma Dataset: 128-electrode dataset obtained from 14 healthy subjects with roughly 1000 four-second trials of executed movements divided into 13 runs per subject. The four classes of movements were movements of either the left hand, the right hand, both feet, and rest.
 Left/Right Hand 1D/2D movements: 19-electrode data of one subject with various combinations of 1D and 2D hand movements (actual execution).
 Imagination of Right-hand Thumb Movement: In every trial, subjects were asked to rest and rest data was recorded for 5 mins. Further, 5 second epoch data was also recorded when subjects were asked to imagine right hand thumb movement. 5 of such imagined motor movement, and rest state was recorded for each trial. Single subject, 8 electrodes at 256Hz.
 Mental-Imagery Dataset: 13 participants with over 60,000 examples of motor imageries in 4 interaction paradigms recorded with 38 channels medical-grade EEG system. It contains data for upto 6 mental imageries primarily for the motor moements.  [Article]
 DEAP: Includes 32 subjects, each watchine 1-min long excerpts of music-videos, rated by users in terms of arousal/valence/like-dislike/dominanace/famaliarity, and frontal face recording of 22/32 subejcts.
 Enterface'06: Enterface'06 Project 07: EEG(64 Channels) + fNIRS + face video, Includes 16 subjects, where emotions were elicited through selected subset of IAPS dataset.
 Imagined Emotion: 31 subjects, subjects listen to voice recordings that suggest an emotional feeling and ask subjects to imagine an emotional scenario or to recall an experience in which they have felt that emotion before.
 NeuroMarketing: 25 subjects, 14 electrodes, Like/Dislike on commercial e-commerce products over 14 categories with 3 images each. Article for the dataset: Analysis of EEG signals and its application to neuromarketing.  [Article]
 SEED: 15 subjects were shown video clips eliciting positive/negative/neutral emotion and EEG was recorded over 62 channels.
 SEED-IV: 15 subjects were shown video clips ellicity happy/sad/neutral/fear emotions and EEG was recorded over 62 channels (with eye-tracking) for 3 sessions per subject (24 trials per session).
 SEED-VIG: Vigilance labels with EEG data in a simulated driving task. 18 electrodes and eye-tracking included.
 HCI-Tagging: Subjetcs were shown video clips (fragments of movies) and they were asked to annotate the emotional state on the scale of valence and arousal. During the whole experiment, audio, video, gaze data and physiological data were recorded simultaneously with accurate synchronisation between sensors.
 Regulation of Arousal: 18 subjects going through an online flight simulator study with three different audio-feedback silence, sham and BCI.  [Article]
 BCI-NER Challenge: 26 subjects, 56 EEG Channels for a P300 Speller task, and labeled dataset for the response elicited when P300 decodes a correct or incorrect letter.
 Monitoring ErrP in a target selection task: 6 subjects with 64 EEG electrodes, watching a cursor move towards a target square, and elicited responses are labeled based on whether the cursor moves in right or wrong direction.  [Dataset Description]
 ErrPs during continuous feedback: 10 subjects with 28 EEG electrodes, playing a video game to study execution and outcome error.  [Dataset Part-1]  [Dataset Part-2]
 HCI-Tagging: Subjetcs were shown images or movie fragments with a tag at the bottom of the screen. In some cases, the tag correctly described something about the situation. However, in other cases the tag did not actually apply to the media item. After each item, a participant was asked to press a green button if they agreed with the tag being applicable to the media item, or press a red button if not. During the whole experiment, audio, video, gaze data and physiological data were recorded simultaneously with accurate synchronisation between sensors.
 c-VEP BCI: 9 subjects, 32 EEG Channels for a VEP BCI speller (32 characters) task, and labeled dataset for the response elicited for the label associated with the speller.  [Dataset description]  [Published article]
 c-VEP BCI with dry electrodes: 9 subjects, 15 dry-EEG Channels for a VEP BCI speller (32 characters) task, and labeled dataset for the response elicited for the label associated with the speller.  [Article]
 SSVEP - Visual Search/Discrimination and Handshake: Includes 3 different tests, (i) Five Box visual test: attnded and unattended disc and square based stimuli, (ii) visual search within natural images: search of a yellow dot stimuli in B&W natural images, (iii) hand shake test: showing left/right hand closed/open images. 30 subjects, 14 electrodes.  [Article 1]  [Article 2]  [More Dataset: Dataset 2]
 Synchronized Brainwave Dataset: 15 people were presented with 2 different video stimulus including blinks, relaxation, mental mathematics, counting color boxes, and watching superbowl ads.  [Stimulus 1]  [Stimulus 2]
 Pattern Visual Evoked Potentials: Dataset#5, 2 subjects for checkboard light pattern (oddball paradigm) recorded at O1 position.
 Face vs. House Discrimination: 7 Epileptic subjects were presented with 50 grayscale stimulations each for Face and House pictures. For each subject, total 3 experimental runs were conducted resulting in 300 stimulations.
 Target Versus Non-Target: 25 subjects testing Brain Invaders, a visual P300 Brain-Computer Interface using oddball paradigm. 16-electrodes, wet.  publication,  code. Dataset id: BI.EEG.2012-GIPSA.
 Target Versus Non-Target: 24 subjects playing Brain Invaders, a visual P300 Brain-Computer Interface using oddball paradigm. 16-electrodes, wet. Up to 8 sessions per subject. Two experiemental conditions: with and without adaptive calibration using Riemannian geometry.  publication,  code. Dataset id: BI.EEG.2013-GIPSA.

A pedestrian wearing a protective mask walks past a boarded up J. Crew Group Inc. store on 14th Street in Washington, D.C., U.S., on Thursday, April 16, 2020. On Wednesday Mayor Muriel Bowser announced an extension of the shutdown of nonessential businesses until May 15 after the original date of April 24. , Bloomberg
   (Bloomberg) -- With the pandemic intensifying the plight of U.S. retailers, companies from J. Crew Group Inc. to the owner of Ann Taylor are using Chapter 11 bankruptcy filings to quickly get out of costly, long-term leases and shutter thousands of stores.
 By seeking court protection, firms like Neiman Marcus Group Inc. and the parent company of Men’s Wearhouse avoid the headache of protracted negotiations with individual landlords. But the moves threaten to upend huge swaths of the real estate market and the half-trillion dollar market for commercial mortgage-backed securities.
 “This is now black-letter law -- a debtor can cram down a landlord,” said Melanie Cyganowski, a former bankruptcy judge who’s now a partner at law firm Otterbourg PC. “If this becomes a tsunami of retailers rejecting their leases, it’s going to trigger another part of the sea change -- the mortgages held by the landlords.”
 As bankrupt firms like J.C. Penney Co. and Brooks Brothers Group Inc. look to jettison leases, landlords are already feeling the consequences. CBL & Associates Properties Inc., owner of more than 100 shopping centers in the U.S., is preparing its own bankruptcy filing after rent collections cratered. And 16% of retail property loans bundled into CMBS were delinquent in July, according to research firm Trepp.
  At least 25 major retailers have filed for bankruptcy this year, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. The most recent additions include Tailored Brands Inc., owner of Men’s Wearhouse and Jos. A. Bank, which is seeking to close about a third of its more than 1,200 stores, and Lord & Taylor parent company Le Tote, which said it could shut down all of the department store’s remaining locations.
 “It’s economical, it’s efficient and it allows retailers to rationalize their footprint quickly,” said Fred Ringel, co-chair of the business finance and restructuring practice at the law firm Robinson Brog Leinwand Greene Genovese & Gluck P.C. Ringel, who works for landlords, said he’s busier than ever renegotiating leases and in some cases persuading tenants to forgo cancellations and stay under modified terms.
 Take vitamin retailer GNC Holdings Inc. It operates hundreds of stores across the country, mostly in strip malls. Since filing for bankruptcy in June, GNC has asked to reject at least 500 leases, along with more than 50 franchise agreements and subleases, according to court records.
  Meanwhile, CEC Entertainment Inc., the parent company of Chuck E. Cheese, is negotiating with its landlords after its June bankruptcy filing. It won court approval this week to defer rent payments as it evaluates which locations it wants to keep open.
 And the U.S. unit of Spanish retailer Desigual said it was forced to file after struggling to get rent abatements from its landlords. “Unfortunately, DUSA had little success in getting landlords to realize the new reality that most tenants -- especially those in retail -- cannot afford to pay pre-Covid-19 rent,” a representative for the firm said in court papers.
 Landlords, in turn, have their own mortgages to worry about, which were also underwritten with pre-pandemic assumptions about rent collections. Amid the stress, Barry Sternlicht’s Starwood Capital Group missed payments on securitized debt linked to five shopping malls, and Saks owner Hudson’s Bay Co. also skipped interest due on certain CMBS. Delinquencies on retail mortgages bundled into bonds climbed to 16% in July, from 3.8% in January, according to Trepp.
  Some retailers can work out rent abatements and other lease modifications including terminations without filing for bankruptcy. However, negotiating hundreds of deals outside of a court process can be challenging, especially for big retail chains that may have hundreds of landlords to deal with, said Navin Nagrani, an executive vice president at Hilco Real Estate.
 Bankruptcy flips the power from landlords to tenants. Retailers can legally reject a swath of leases in court, sometimes leaving building owners to collect just pennies on the dollar. Firms can also sell off favorable contracts to other parties to help repay creditors.
 “Sometimes a bankruptcy is the most advantageous way to get out of those leases,” Nagrani said.
 As many as 25,000 stores are expected to close in the U.S. in 2020, mostly in shopping malls, according to Coresight Research. Department stores and fashion boutiques are seen as the most endangered.
 More than half of mall department stores could close for good by the end of 2021, according to an April report from real estate research firm Green Street Advisors. J.C. Penney said last month that it would shutter more than 150 locations, while Neiman Marcus plans to pull out of New York’s Hudson Yards development and close three other U.S. locations.
 The closures so far are “just the tip of the iceberg,” said Garrick Brown, head of Americas retail research for Cushman & Wakefield. Over the next two years, at least 1.2 billion of square feet -- 10% of already-occupied store real estate -- will go vacant, he said. “Worst-case scenario, that could double.”

这是你专注于加密货币的博客的背景图片，也是你的Twitter简历的背景图片，我们选择它作为代表Taaalk的图片。
这张图片对你意味着什么，它与你对比特币的看法有什么关系？
JMG不是比特币的人，如果说有什么不同的话，那就是更像是一个黄金狂热分子。但他的观点，即我们已经在技术上达到顶峰，未来看起来更像过去，而不是一些星际迷航乌托邦或银翼杀手反乌托邦，这一观点引起了我的共鸣。对我来说，比特币最代表的是向金本位制的回归。只是它将是比特币的标准。因为比特币更便于携带和交易。
正如米尔莎·波佩斯库(Mircea Popescu)在“比特币与穷人”一书中所说，比特币即使不是彻底的耶稣，也是自维多利亚女王(Queen Victoria)以来最保守的东西。比特币使得所谓的累进税收计划行不通。比特币使任何形式的公益都站不住脚。比特币让任何人假装与其他任何人平等的说法变得可笑。比特币不是用来让公社运作的，但恰恰相反：它会让公社变得无法运作，几乎每个人都不会感兴趣。
我不是像波佩斯库那样黑暗的启蒙运动巨魔，但有很多地方我是同意的。比特币不是坐在篝火旁的未来主义的金字塔。这是对自然、对极限、对传统价值观的回归，在很大程度上，它可能会让人感觉像是回到了更早的时代。

首先，似乎比特币对上述未来的发展是有帮助的。这对我来说并不明显。这样对吗？如果是这样的话，为什么会是这样呢？
在金本位制下，政府对你的钱所能做的是有限度的。假设统治阶级想要发动一场战争，或者为你当地的社区大学建造一个新的体育场。他们可以征税。或者他们可以借钱。如果他们借钱，他们必须用黄金偿还借来的钱，就像“权力的游戏”中的铁银行一样。
如果黄金真的是这样运作的，那么金本位制实际上会设定一些限制。
实际上，谁需要黄金标准--我们可以像上帝希望的那样，什么都用黄金交易。不需要政府货币。

1、黄金不适用于小额交易。即使711酒类商店想要接受黄金，你也不能用它买一杯冰沙。你不能在金子里交易。因为它会被吹走然后迷路。

比特币胜出的房产还有很多。但我认为，即使没有3，如果我们只有1和2，我们可能会有一个无处不在的黄金交易世界，就像奇幻小说中的那样。
但由于黄金很容易伪造，我们需要政府在硬币上盖章，由政府警察来惩罚造假者。你得付钱给警察。它很贵。
由于黄金不适用于小额交易，因此我们有小面额硬币和纸币。
让我们加4吧，也许是最重要的一个。黄金很难拿到。所以我们把它放在我们最信任的地方。政府银行。我们用的是可以兑换黄金的纸。当统治阶级想要战争时，他们在政府中的走狗太诱人了，他们会说，对不起，你的比索过去值1/16盎司黄金，现在值1/23盎司。不过，别担心。经济需要它。尼克松。罗斯福。德国。英国。罗马帝国。每个人都这么做了。所以这不是说人们在它发生了这么多次之后没有预见到它的到来。但黄金实在太难保护了，真的没有更好的选择了。

人们说，比特币太难使用了，没有人能费这么大劲来保护一个硬件钱包。好的，让你的银行保管好它。关键是，比特币给了你一个选择。

比特币的工作方式与黄金爱好者想象的黄金工作方式一样。在我看来，这就是为什么你需要比特币来获得真正的金本位。或者更确切地说，是比特币标准。

在我开始探讨超比特币化和我们现在必须面对的尴尬的货币汤之前，您介意简要解释一下为什么黄金是货币的基础吗？
在这个日复一日的世界里，人们很容易忘记黄金，因为我更多地考虑的是我每GB 1美元能买到的那袋糖果，而不是什么让我的每GB 1美元有任何价值的原因。
金钱不是你通常想的东西，也不是大多数人想过的东西。钱只是你用的东西，就像电一样。只要你按下开关，灯就亮了，谁在乎电是怎么工作的。
只有当灯开始闪烁时，你才会开始在意。受过高中教育的阿根廷出租车司机比拥有博士学位的兰德智库经济学家更了解金钱的运作方式。因为“经济学人”的光芒从未熄灭过。如果出租车司机超过30岁，他已经让他们出去两三次了。
如果你注意了，灯开始闪烁了，对每个人来说都是如此。
那么什么是钱呢？我们想要的钱是什么？为什么黄金是这一点的基础呢？
这上面洒了很多墨水。我想该轮到我了。开始了！
1，我们只想让钱发挥作用。应该很方便。货币便利性意味着稀缺性、耐用性、可分割性和可互换性(也称为可互换)。
2，我们希望它能够工作，而不必信任太多的系统或人员。钱应该是信任度最低的。
在Money…之前。我们实际上并不知道那么多。人类学家和考古学家对当时的社会如何经济运作做了大量的理论研究。不过幸运的是，其中至少有一部分是有记录的历史。
无论如何，如果你是比特币MAX，那么不管怎么说，流行的故事都是这样的。
早期部落的默认制度是礼物经济和荣誉制度。这些都很棒，在公社和小村庄里仍然有。但是他们需要很大的信任。当你没有信任的时候，钱就是你用的。
让我们试着以物易物吧。我给你一头牛，你给我一些小麦。不需要信任。即刻结算。但是不太方便。因为如果我想要的小麦数量与奶牛的价值不符怎么办？奶牛不是很容易区分的。我不想为一头整头(未分割的)奶牛吃太多小麦，因为我必须在它变坏之前把它吃了。小麦是相当可分的，但它不耐用。如果你让牛活着，它比小麦更耐用。而且，如果你把牛肉干，或者制作面粉，在一定条件下储存，牛和小麦都可以变得更耐用。但这是一项繁重的工作。
我们可以试着用债务。我给你一头牛，你给我一些小麦，你欠我一些小麦。如果我想从另一个人那里得到什么，而他也想要小麦，我可以让你把你欠我的小麦给他，然后我就能得到我想要的。但这需要信任。不只是你我之间，还有你和另一个人。钱的全部意义就是把信任降到最低。债务不是钱。它有它的用途。但这不是钱。
奶牛和小麦也是不可替代的。这是个花哨的词，意思是“可互换”。一种商品或商品的财产，其单个单位基本上是可互换的，其每个部分与另一个部分无法区分。有些小麦可能会有点变质。你不能用一头老牛代替一头新牛。
我们使用wampum，也就是海贝壳要好得多。蛤壳稀缺，可替换，经久耐用，足够小，你不需要将它们分开，而且很难假冒。你也可以把它们戴在项链上，便于携带。虽然有些稀缺，但也不算太稀缺。海滩上有足够多的蛤蜊壳，你可以在它们上面运行经济。比牛和小麦好多了。
如果你有足够的wampum，我就把牛卖给你，我们马上就算账。由于其良好的特性，wampum变得普遍接受。因此，如果我相信你会给我一张借条，那么很容易用wampum来计价债务。因此，它也让债务变得更容易管理。
至于我们想要的钱是什么，用wampum我们基本上已经完成了。
当你堆成大堆时，贝壳会被压扁。没有我们希望的那么耐用。而且有些贝壳比其他贝壳更漂亮，所以你最终会试图从wampum项链中挑选出最漂亮的贝壳，这会浪费时间。不像我们希望的那样具有互换性。此外，由于蛤蜊长在岩石上，而你一直在吃，如果你带来的蛤蜊比被碾碎或当作珠宝藏起来的更多，你就会得到蛤壳膨胀。并不像我们希望的那样稀缺。
黄金基本上是wampum，但更均匀耐用，供应有限。你把它熔化并提纯，所有的黄金都是一样的。它不生锈，也不会碎裂。而且它被很好地掩埋了，所以通货膨胀是有争议的。事实上，当发现一个新的大型金矿时，就会出现通货膨胀问题，就像在各种历史上的淘金热潮中发生的那样。但总体而言还不算太差。
这就是为什么当我们想到金钱时，从地下城、龙到迪士尼电影，我们集体脑海中浮现的是黄金。
尼克·萨博(Nick Szabo)在“支付”中谈到了从wampum到贵金属的转变，以及其他许多有趣的事情：货币的起源，这是从经典到比特币的座右铭。
顺便说一句，乔希(或其他读者)在考虑想要的便利属性--稀缺、耐用、可分割、可替换--时，你认为黄金有问题吗？如果有的话，你会说哪一个是最重要的？顺便说一句，没有正确的答案，只是需要考虑一下。
黄金不会生锈！这很有趣。这一点和你其余的回答在我的思维导图中构成了一个巨大的基础，那就是如何思考金钱。
因此，可分割性似乎就是金价下跌的地方。或许也是比特币站稳脚跟的地方。(除了可以通过互联网发送--你之前链接到的中正帖子，想象一下，一种贵金属可以通过通信渠道运输，现在更有意义了。)。
但在我们到达那里之前，为什么黄金不能完全从现代货币中提炼出来呢？我隐约知道，金本位制在七八十年代的某个时候被取消或放宽了……。这个世界似乎在艰难前行。
人们感觉，在空壳交易者的社区里，贝壳的涌入可能会造成很大的麻烦，但在现代发达经济体中，这似乎更不透明。我在海滩上找不到现代货币，所以我自己的个人供应很有限，宽松的金本位制对当今大多数人生活的世界有什么影响？
你可以试试。这不是我们第一次去牛仔竞技表演了。自罗马帝国以来，各国政府一直在膨胀并脱离金本位制。但黄金一直在回升。因为人们喜欢存黄金。因为他们理所当然地担心政府货币的通货膨胀会导致价值的急剧下降。大多数现代储户可能更喜欢房子、股票或艺术品。但黄金永远不会完全消失。它是受保护货币的象征。它在集体思想中占据了那个位置。
我在海滩上找不到现代钞票，所以我自己的个人供应量有限。
在你的个人经历中，这对你来说是正确的，但并不是所有人都是正确的。阿根廷出租车司机的情况并非如此。对于魏玛利亚德国人来说就不是这样了。对你来说，这不会无限期地持续下去。
恶性通货膨胀就像是破产。它在很长一段时间内发生得很慢。然后它一下子就发生了。我们正接近快慢阶段之间的拐点。你可以看看各大中央政府的资产负债表，看到政府债务数额的巨大增长，这转化为印钞。
据我所知，自CORONA以来，美国联邦储备委员会(Federal Reserve)的资产负债表翻了一番，从大约3万亿美元增加到6万亿美元。这在世界各地都是相似的。这些数字让人目瞪口呆。2008年，这一数字较小，但仍令人难以置信。每一次危机，数字都会变得更大。在某种程度上，你会给小费。
沙滩上有更多的贝壳等着你。当你感觉到的时候，总有一天会为你而来。
然后每个人都是百万富翁，但是货架上没有牛奶。政府法定货币的恶性通货膨胀是一件可怕的事情。它是种族灭绝、世界大战和几代人挥之不去的创伤的产物。这种痛苦和恐惧就是为什么储蓄者自从有了政府的钱就一直渴望黄金的原因。如果你正在经历法定货币贬值的缓慢阶段，保护你的购买力听起来很无聊，但在你给了小费之后，这真的是生死攸关。
对于那些较晚采用比特币的人来说，超比特币不会是一件令人愉快的事情，尤其是在情感上。但与恶性通货膨胀相比，这是一个好得多的选择。不管怎样，大多数人的大部分储蓄都不是以法定形式存在的。大多数人都是债务人。菲亚特的债务人。随着超比特币化的进行，对越来越多怨恨的千禧一代来说，感觉像债务奴役的住房抵押贷款和学生贷款将以贬值的、最终一文不值的法定货币计价。这相当于一个禧年，你基本上只是注销了所有无论如何都不会偿还的债务。
我的直觉是，超比特币化会让人感觉有点像俄罗斯共产主义的垮台。这是一段艰难的时期，但总体上是朝着正确的方向前进的。你会注意到，你的电费账单希望你用比特币支付，711希望你用比特币支付冰沙，然后逐渐首先，然后是所有地方，所有人都只想用比特币支付。然后事情就结束了，你再也不会去想这件事了。
不知何故，发达经济体(在很长一段时间内，肯定是在我的记忆中)避免了恶性通货膨胀……。但是它马上就要来了！当它到来的时候，比特币就坐在那里等着吃掉/解决所有的混乱。
可以说，你的头寸与价值投资者沃伦·巴菲特(Warren Buffet)的头寸相似。长期以来，他一直觉得市场价格过高，以至于他拥有超过1300亿美元的现金储备，他没有信心以今天的价格进行投资。但他相信以价值为基础的定价的基本面，以至于等待是一种显而易见的策略-尽管在此期间，他错过了许多有争议的虚假价值。
你有没有同样的信念，认为发达经济体的恶性通货膨胀/超级比特币化是一个如此根本的事件，这只是一个时间问题，而不是是否会发生的问题？
巴菲特公开表示不喜欢比特币。对他来说，股票和企业是一种价值储存。他明白他们的意思，而且他做功课。沃伦也不投资科技股。技术并不是他的优势所在。
对于比特币持有者来说，比特币是他们的优势所在。他们已经做了功课。不只是在经济方面，所有不方便和令人厌恶的科技东西也是如此。比如学会使用冷钱包，保护备份的安全，而不是把硬币放在容易蒸发的交易所里，所有这些都是如此。如果我没记错的话，你在这里被咬了。这很常见。我也有过。很多比特币只是在痛苦中学习。
比特币狂热者是狂热分子，但他们是理性狂热分子。这就是为什么你会从早期得到这些巨大的冰冷硬币的原因，这些硬币从来都卖不出去。这是“指环王”里的咕噜。或者是斯茂格。
因此，无论如何，我和巴菲特在比特币作为价值投资的问题上意见不一--因为巴菲特还没有做好比特币的功课--但我们在价值投资的大前提上意见一致。关于巴菲特投资的那些东西，我也没有做过功课，所以我不会轻蔑。作为一名投资者，很多成功都是专业的，知道你知道什么和不知道什么，并且足够聪明地坚持自己的路线。
就目前而言，美元是一种很好的价值储存手段，所以巴菲特持有他的美元储备是不错的，尽管他可能会错过下一波比特币价格升值的机会。当他需要上船的时候，他会把它弄清楚的。
是的，我对比特币深信不疑。当然，没有什么是百分之百的。但我的想法是，在12到15年内实现超比特币化，届时我们将稳定在每枚比特币1000万美元左右的购买力。
抱歉，我只是想澄清一下，我并不是说你们持有相同的观点，而是你们都对一些你们认为几乎是基本的东西有强烈的信念。
尽管我听说比特币是由一位名叫智史(Satoshi)的人创立的，但我无法想象，如果是一个有想法的人与网络上的其他人隔绝开来，比特币还会产生如此大的吸引力。感觉就像，尽管它归功于一个人，但它一定是从一个对共同主题感兴趣的在线社区中产生的。
是这样吗？如果是这样的话，他们是在讨论比特币解决的浮动法定问题，还是比特币的存在是为了解决另一个问题？发现自己是另一个人的解决方案。
我有点像是在问一个问题，想看看比特币的大爆炸。不是后来的扩张，而是理解它产生的背后的想法，并描绘它发生的那一刻。

  JMG is not a bitcoin guy, more of a gold bug if anything. But his idea that we have peaked technologically and that the future looks more like the past than some star trek utopia, or blade runner dystopia, resonates with me. To me what bitcoin represents most of all is a return to the gold standard. Except it will be a bitcoin standard. Because bitcoin is a bit more convenient to carry around and transact in.
 As mircea popescu put it in  Bitcoin and the Poor, "Bitcoin is the most conservative thing since at least queen Victoria, if not outright Jesus. Bitcoin makes so-called "progressive" tax schemes unworkable. Bitcoin makes any sort of public welfare untenable. Bitcoin makes anyone's pretense of equality with anyone else risible. Bitcoin isn't here to "make communes work", but quite the contrary : it will render communes both inoperable and uninteresting to pretty much everyone."
 I'm not quite as dark enlightenment trolly as popescu, but there's a lot there that I agree with. Bitcoin is not some futuristic kumbaya sit around the campfire thing. It's a return of nature, of limits, of traditional values, and to a large degree it may feel like a reset to earlier times.
 I think some countries may be able to retain some vestiges of the modern welfare state, post hyperbitcoinization. It won't be easy. There is not going to be a universal basic income (UBI). Sorry.
  Firstly, it seems bitcoin is instrumental to the development of a future like the one described above. This  not obvious to me. Is this correct? And if so why is this the case?
  Under a gold standard, there is a limit to what the government can do to your money. Say the ruling class wants to start a war, or build a new stadium for your local community college. They can tax. Or they can borrow. If they borrow, they have to pay back what they borrowed in gold, like the  Iron Bank in Game of Thrones.
 And if gold actually worked that way, a gold standard would actually set some limits.
  Actually who needs a gold "standard" -- we could just transact in gold for everything, like god intended. No government currencies needed.
 We got government currencies because gold does not in fact act like our platonic ideal of it.
 1, Gold doesn't work for for small transactions. Even if the 711 liquor store wanted to accept gold, you couldn't buy a slurpee with it. You can't transact in gold dust. Because it blows away and gets lost.
 2, gold is surprisingly easy to counterfeit. Lot of gold painted tungsten bars on ebay. This is good enough to pass a water volume test. Do you have an x ray crystallographer?
  There's a bunch more properties where bitcoin wins. But I think even without 3, if we just had 1 and 2, we might have a ubiquitous gold transaction world like in fantasy novels.
 But since gold is easy to counterfeit, we need coins stamped by the government, with government police to punish counterfeiters. You have to pay the police. It's expensive.
 And since gold doesn't work with small transactions, we have small denomination coins and paper notes for that.
 Let's add 4, maybe the most important one. Gold is hard to secure. So we keep it in the place we trust the most. The government bank. And we use paper that is redeemable for gold. When the ruling class then wants a war it is just too tempting for their lackeys in the government to say, sorry, your pesos that used to be worth 1/16 ounce of gold, are now worth 1/23 ounce. But don't worry about it. The economy needed it.  Nixon.  Roosevelt.  Germany.  England.  The roman empire. Everyone did it. So it's not like people didn't see it coming after it happened all these times. But gold is just too hard to secure, there was really no better option.
 You could argue war mongering lackeys is just a straw man. Well intentioned democratically elected leaders that want to promote social equality are even worse! Everyone wants to spend, spend spend, whether you agree with their ideals or not.
 Getting back to point 4, secure storage. In  Silas Marner, this weaver works his whole life to save up a gold hoard and hides it in the floor of his little hut. Then this dissolute upper class guy figures out where he hid it and just takes it to pay off a gambling debt.
 Not so easy with bitcoin! Actually not so hard. If Dunstan had gotten Silas's hardware wallet paper backup and Silas wasn't using a passphrase, he could have gotten it all. But Silas CAN use a passphrase. Silas can use 2-of-2 or 2-of-3 multisig for deep cold storage, and keep the other keys with people he trusts. Or more realistically, since he has trust issues, at least somewhere harder to get at than the floor of his hut.
  People say, bitcoin is too hard to use, nobody can go through all this hassle to secure a hardware wallet. Fine, have your bank secure it. The point is, bitcoin gives you a choice.
 The issue with gold is, because of its physical properties you have no choice but to trust third party vaults. Once you are doing that, the best option is to trust the government central bank vault. And the government can't be trusted not to devalue.
 Bitcoin works the way gold bugs imagine gold works. To my mind this is why you need bitcoin to get a real gold standard. Or rather a  bitcoin standard.
 PS: A great way to secure a hardware wallet is to embed it in a giant cube of concrete, say 10 feet on a side. The buttons and screen get routed to the outside . So if you have the pin code, it works as expected, just kind of unwieldy. If you want to steal it, you have to dig out and haul a huge block of concrete, or use jackhammers to get at the electronics somewhere in the middle of it. Hopefully the noise would wake up the neighbors.
 I expect in a few years, with hyperbitcoinization approaching, citibank or wells fargo or someone will actually be doing this.

 It is easy to forget about gold in a day-to-day world where I'm thinking more about the bag of sweets my $/£ is going to get me, than what is responsible for my $/£ having any value at all.
  Money isn't something that you usually think about, or most people ever think about. Money is just something you use, like electricity. As long as the lights go on when you flip the switch, who cares how electricity works.
 It's when the lights start flickering that you start to care. An argentine cab driver with a high school education is more sophisticated about how money works than a RAND thinktank economist with a phd. Because the lights haven't ever gone out for the economist. The cab driver if he's over 30 has had them go out already two or three times.
 If you are paying attention,  the lights are starting to flicker just a bit, for everyone.
 So what is money? What do we want money to be? And why is gold fundamental to that?

 1, we want money to just work. It should be CONVENIENT. Convenience for money means SCARCE, DURABLE, DIVISIBLE, and FUNGIBLE (aka interchangeable).
 2, we want it to work, without having to trust too many systems or people. Money should be TRUST MINIMIZING.

 The default system for tribes of the early days is gift economies and honor systems. These are great, and you still have them in communes and small villages. But they require a lot of TRUST. Money is what you use when you don't have trust.
 Let's try bartering. I give you a cow, you give me some wheat. No trust required. Instant settlement. But not very convenient. Because what if the amount of wheat I want doesn’t match the value of the cow? Cows aren't very DIVISIBLE. And I don’t want to accept too much wheat for a whole (undivided) cow, because I would have to eat it before it goes bad. Wheat is fairly divisible but it isn't DURABLE. A cow is more durable than wheat, if you keep it alive. And both cows and wheat can be made more durable if you jerky the cow, or make flour and store it under certain conditions. But it's a lot of work.
 We could try using debt. I give you a cow, you give me some wheat, and you owe me some wheat for later. If there’s something I want from another guy and he also wants wheat, I can get you to give him the wheat you owe me and then I get what I want. But this requires TRUST. Not just between you and me, but you and the other guy. The whole point of money is to minimize trust. Debt isn't money. It has its uses. But it isn't money.
 Cows and wheat also aren't  FUNGIBLE. Which is a fancy word for interchangeable. "The property of a good or a commodity whose individual units are essentially interchangeable, and each of its parts is indistinguishable from another part." Some wheat could be a little spoiled. You can't substitute an old cow for a new cow.
 We're much better off using wampum, i.e. sea shells. Clam shells are scarce, fungible, durable, small enough you don't need to divide them, and hard to counterfeit. You can also wear them in necklaces, making them convenient to carry around. And while somewhat scarce, they aren't too scarce. There’s enough clam shells on the beach that you can run an economy on them. Much better than cows and wheat.
 If you have enough wampum, I just sell you the cow and we square up right away. Thanks to its good properties, wampum becomes universally acceptable. Therefore, if I trust you for an IOU, it’s easy to denominate the debt in wampum. So it makes debt more manageable too.

  Shells get squished when you make giant piles. Not as durable as we'd like. 使用微内核的好处是安全性--它的代码足够少，您可以确信它是完全安全的。
缺点是，因为在其他设计下原本驻留在内核中的东西现在都在用户区域，所以它们必须执行IPC来通信--而IPC有一些开销。
IPC是微内核中最热的热路径，相应地，任天堂将IPC中涉及的每个函数都标记为__ATTRIBUTE__((ALYSY_INLINE))，这对逆向工程来说是一种巨大的痛苦。
此外，任天堂将SvcReplyAndReceive实现为允许微服务服务器进程在一次调用中回复和接收新消息的单个系统调用。
这就是说，实际上管理费用比你想象的要少。FUSE之所以比用于FS的内核驱动程序慢，过去是因为FUSE必须与内核对话才能执行文件系统操作，所以当您读取文件时，您的进程-&>FUSE-&>内核-&>硬件。相比之下，在Horizon上，内核完全不参与文件系统管理(它甚至没有映射sdmmc硬件)。因此，进程将执行进程-&gt；FS系统模块进程-&gt；硬件。
在Horizon中，所有东西显然都不是文件。没有Unix/Linux有特殊的/dev/东西那样的全局文件系统路径。
Horizon中不存在管道--所有IPC都是通过Horizon IPC(HIPC)协议完成的。
UNIX/POSIX有fork()和子进程之类的东西……但是在基于功能的操作系统中，创建进程是一项令人难以置信的特权操作。Fork()不可能在Horizon中实现，所有线程都是通过SvcCreateThread()创建的。子进程并不存在。
note_en:
The advantage to using a microkernel is security -- there's sufficiently little code that you can actually be confident it's all secure.
 The disadvantage is that because things that would live in the kernel under other designs are now in userland, they have to do IPC to communicate -- and IPC has some overhead.
 IPC is the hottest hot-path in a microkernel, correspondingly Nintendo marked every function involved in IPC as __attribute__((always_inline)), this was kind of a huge pain to reverse engineer as a result.
 In addition, Nintendo implemented "SvcReplyAndReceive" as a single system call that allows a microservice server process to reply to and receive a new message in one invocation.
 That said, there's actually less overhead than you think. Past of why FUSE is slower than a kernel driver for FS is because FUSE has to talk to the kernel to do filesystem stuff, so when you read a file you have your process -> FUSE -> kernel -> hardware. In comparison, on Horizon the kernel is completely uninvolved in filesystem management (it doesn't even have the sdmmc hardware mapped). Thus processes will do process -> FS system module process -> hardware.
    In Horizon, everything is very distinctly not a file. There's no global filesystem paths the way that unix/linux have special  /dev/whatever.
 Pipes don't exist in Horizon -- all IPC is done via the  horizon ipc ("HIPC") protocol.
 UNIX/POSIX have stuff like fork() and child processes...but creating a process is an incredibly privileged operation in a capability-based operating system. Fork() is impossible to implement in Horizon, all threads are created via SvcCreateThread() instead. Child processes aren't a thing that exist.

If you’ve spent any time in tech circles lately, there are three letters you’ve surely heard: SRE. Site Reliability Engineering is the defining movement in tech today. Giants like Google and Amazon market their ability to provide reliable service and startups are now investing in reliability as an early priority.
 But what makes reliability engineering so important? In this blog, we’ll look at three big benefits of investing in reliability and explain how you can get started on your journey to reliability excellence.
  A reliable service is more valuable to a customer than one with inconsistent performance. It seems so obvious that you may think it goes without saying, but this reminder is crucial. Picture a typical user of your service. They are happy and engaged as they use your unique features, but don’t ignore the underlying assumption: your service works. Regardless of how your features stack up to competitors, users will always choose a functional option over a function-rich one. No feature is more important than reliability.
 Regardless of how your features stack up to competitors, users will always choose a functional option over a function-rich one. No feature is more important than reliability.
 The consequences of unreliable software are also more costly than the proactive investment in reliability. Consider how dependent you are on technology. On a given day, you rely on an alarm to wake you up, an app to report the weather, and a calendar that reminds you of your schedule. You might hail a ride from Uber or use Google Maps to avoid traffic on the freeway. Maybe you get lunch delivered from Grubhub. When you arrive home, your Amazon package is right where you expect it. We trust in these services.. When they go down, we feel angry.
 These are the standards your service is judged by in the era of reliability. When the most popular software boasts uptime percentages of  five nines, users begin to expect a level of consistency where downtime is a non-concern. The value generated by investing in reliability isn’t just in the additional uptime of your service, but in keeping your customers happy with your brand, increasing users, and lowering the potential for churn.
  You may think of reliability engineering as an overhead cost to development, an additional layer of work that must be accounted for. It’s true that time and energy must be dedicated to reliability, but you’ll find that adopting SRE best practices can actually empower and accelerate development.
  SLOs and error budgeting work as a system to ensure downtime, latency, and other indicators of unreliability are kept within acceptable bounds. When these acceptable metrics are exceeded, SLO policies can refocus development efforts to stabilize and repair. On the other hand, when SLOs are within acceptable ranges and error budget is available, development can safely accelerate. Proposed changes that may affect reliability can be measured against the SLO, allowing you to build new features with confidence.
 SLOs can also empower effective development by highlighting areas of greatest business impact.  When determining your SLIs (the indicators your SLOs measure) you’ll discover insights on what areas of your service matter most to users. When you understand exactly what your users expect, you understand how your service is positioned and how to develop towards customer happiness.
  Despite proactive measures, incidents are inevitable. However, with SRE principles, what would otherwise be considered a setback can become another investment in development. An  incident retrospective is a document collaboratively constructed in response to an incident and reviewed by those involved afterwards. This may seem at first like additional work in a situation where time is already limited, but the time it saves more than makes up for it. By analyzing patterns in incidents, developers learn where to spend proactive efforts in reliability. It also encourages developers to look at ways to avoid common classes of bugs and incentivizes writing more performant code.
 Despite proactive measures, incidents are inevitable. However, with SRE principles, what would otherwise be considered a setback can become another investment in development.
  SRE principles also accelerate development through their focus on automation and consistency. By making the investment to codify DevOps processes in  runbooks, where steps and checks are clearly outlined, common tasks can be made faster or even automatic. SRE encourages consistency in  how incidents are classified and what responses each severity level demands. This consistency encourages fast and confident incident responses via streamlined collaboration.
  SRE isn’t just a set of practices and policies—it’s a mentality on how to develop software in a culture free of blame. By embracing this new mindset, your team’s morale and camaraderie will improve, allowing everyone to work at their full potential in a  psychologically safe environment.
 SRE teaches us that failure is inevitable. No matter how many precautions you take, incidents happen. While giving you the tools to respond effectively to these incidents, SRE also challenges us to celebrate these failures. When something new goes wrong, it means there’s a chance to learn about your systems. This attitude creates an environment of  continuous learning.
 When analyzing these inevitable incidents, it’s important to maintain an attitude of  blamelessness. Instead of wasting time pointing fingers and finding fault, work together to find the systematic issues behind the incident. By avoiding a culture of blame and shame, engineers are less afraid to proactively raise issues. Team members will trust each other more, assuming good faith in their teammates’ choices. This spirit of blameless collaboration will transform the most challenging incidents into opportunities for growing stronger together.
 At the heart of these lessons is the  idea of putting the human first: either when considering the impact of reliability on users, or the developers keeping things afloat. Success depends on understanding how your users and developers feel and truly empathizing with them when making decisions. SRE gives you the tools to connect these empathetic insights with actionable data.
 SRE isn’t just a set of practices and policies—it’s a mentality on how to develop software in a culture free of blame. By embracing this new mindset, your team’s morale and camaraderie will improve, allowing everyone to work at their full potential in a psychologically safe environment.
  In the era of reliability, there’s no better time than now to start on your SRE journey!
 For learning the practical details of SRE, check out  Google’s landmark textbook or the  accompanying Coursera course. Blameless offers an  essentials guide if you’re more pressed for time. You can find more great resources on all aspects of SRE in our  list of top SRE resources.

苹果Mac操作系统的下一个主要版本MacOS Big Sur的公开测试版现已面市。新的更新给MacOS带来了一次视觉上的大变革，同时也增加了一些全新的增强功能。
如果您正在考虑安装MacOS Big Sur公开测试版，请注意，它仍然是测试版。这意味着您可能会遇到一些意想不到的错误，并且您所依赖的软件可能还不能在新操作系统上运行。在安装Big Sur之前，请确保您所有的重要文档都已备份到安全的地方，如果可能的话，您应该只将其安装在辅助Mac上。
但如果你真的掷骰子安装了Big Sur测试版，你会立即发现它看起来与之前的MacOS版本有很大的不同，因为苹果在整个操作系统上都做出了重大的设计改变。例如，Windows的白色要多得多(除非您使用的是深色模式，在这种情况下，仍然有很多黑色)。苹果的应用程序图标进行了重大整容，现在变成了圆形正方形，就像iOS的应用程序图标一样。菜单栏现在是半透明的，与墙纸融为一体。
在大苏尔，苹果增加了一个专用的控制中心(Control Center)，就像iOS多年来一直拥有的那样，让你可以轻松地在一个地方管理Wi-Fi和蓝牙连接，以及Mac的显示屏亮度和音量等项目。通知中心不再是通知和小部件的两个独立面板；它现在合并为一个。
如果您是Safari用户，您也会注意到一些重大变化。您现在可以设置一个自定义的起始页，允许您添加诸如您的收藏夹、经常访问的网站，甚至是您选择的背景图像之类的内容。选项卡也得到了一些改进：默认情况下，图标是打开的，当你将鼠标悬停在选项卡上时，它会显示该网页的预览。和iOS14一样，MacOS Big Sur的Safari也提供了苹果所谓的隐私报告，它会告诉你浏览器为你屏蔽了哪些追踪器。
Messages在大苏尔也得到了一些亟需的改进。你终于可以像在iOS上那样发送消息效果了，这意味着你可以向你的联系人发送虚拟的五彩纸屑、气球、激光等等(但前提是他们也在iMessage上)。IOS14上消息的一些新更新也将出现在Big Sur上，比如固定对话和内联回复。
在Big Sur中还有更多我在这里没有触及的东西，比如对地图的改进，一套新的系统声音，以及Mac标志性的开机钟声的回归。因此，如果您确实安装了Big Sur公开测试版，有相当多的内容需要深入研究。

The public beta of macOS Big Sur, the next major release of Apple’s Mac operating system, is now available. The new update brings a big visual overhaul to macOS while also adding a number of brand-new enhancements.
 If you’re thinking about installing the macOS Big Sur public beta, be warned that it’s still, well, a beta. That means you could experience some unexpected bugs, and software you rely on may not work with the new OS just yet. Before you install Big Sur, make sure all of your important documents are backed up somewhere safe, and if at all possible, you should only install this on a secondary Mac.
 But if you  do roll the dice and install the Big Sur beta, you’ll immediately see that it looks much different than previous versions of macOS, as Apple has made significant design changes across the entire operating system. Windows have a whole lot more white, for example (unless you’re using dark mode, in which case, there’s still a lot of black). Apple’s app icons have received a major facelift and are now rounded squares, like iOS’s app icons. And the menu bar is now translucent, blending into your wallpaper.
   In Big Sur, Apple has added a dedicated Control Center, like what iOS has had for years, making it easy to manage items like your Wi-Fi and Bluetooth connections and the display brightness and volume of your Mac, all in one place. And Notification Center is no longer two separate panels for notifications and widgets; it’s now combined into one.
   If you’re a Safari user, you’ll notice some big changes, too. You can now set a customized start page, letting you add things like your favorites, frequently visited websites, and even a background image of your choice. Tabs get some improvements as well: favicons are turned on by default, and when you hover your mouse over a tab, it shows a preview of that webpage. And like iOS 14, Safari in macOS Big Sur offers what Apple calls a Privacy Report, which shows you what trackers the browser has blocked for you.
   Messages is also getting some much-needed improvements in Big Sur. You can  finally send the message effects like the ones on iOS, meaning you can send virtual confetti, balloons, lasers, and more to your contacts (though only if they’re also on iMessage). Some of the new updates to Messages on iOS 14 are coming to Big Sur, too, such as pinned conversations and inline replies.
   There’s a bunch more packed into Big Sur that I didn’t touch on here, such as improvements to Maps, a suite of new system sounds, and the  return of the Mac’s iconic startup chime. So if you do install the Big Sur public beta, there’s a fair amount to dig into.
 I’ve been running the Big Sur developer betas on my personal MacBook Air purchased in 2014 without too many issues, and I like a lot of the changes, especially to Messages. But I pretty much only use Apple-made apps on that computer, so I can’t really speak to how other apps you might rely on will run. If you decide to install the public beta, just know that things may not work like you expect them to just yet.

Snapchat正在推出一系列新工具和功能，帮助年轻人为11月的选举做好投票准备。
重要原因：Snapchat对Z世代和千禧一代的人口结构有着无与伦比的影响力。它建立的工具是为了引导那些特定的人群获得更多的资源，帮助他们登记投票并形成投票计划。其他专注于选民登记的平台是在考虑到更广泛的用户群体的情况下这样做的。
选民注册“迷你”：Snapchat在今年早些时候的合作伙伴峰会上宣布了一项新功能，允许外部开发者直接在Snapchat中构建实用程序。新的“选民登记迷你”允许用户直接在Snapchat注册投票。它还将包括一个跟踪器，用于监控有多少用户在Snapchat上注册投票。
选民指南：Snapchat正在推出一个新的选民指南，为用户提供有关邮寄投票、选票教育和选民登记等主题的信息。该指南可以通过关键字搜索获得，并将以NAACP、ACLU、BallotReady、DemocracyWorks、APIA Vote、我是选民、投票日、全国选民登记日等专家组织的资源为特色。
在你投票“迷你”之前：Snapchat正在与BallotReady合作推出一项新的迷你功能，帮助Snapchat用户了解不同的投票选项(面对面投票、邮寄投票等)。并将鼓励他们制定投票计划。
选民清单：Snapchat正在推出一个新的选民门户，它将作为一个清单，帮助用户注册投票，并将出现在每个Snapchat的用户档案中。
总体情况：2018年中期选举期间，Snapchat通过其应用程序成功注册了45万人。5月份公布的数据显示，登记的人中有50%实际上出去投票了。
下一步是什么：新工具将在9月份推出，但Snapchat将于周四在投票权法案55周年纪念日宣布这些工具。Snapchat表示，它还将在其内容部门Discover中发布新内容，这将有助于告知用户如何注册投票和投票。
note_en:
Snapchat is rolling out a slew of new tools and features to help prepare young people to vote in the November election.
 Why it matters: Snapchat has unparalleled reach into Gen Z and Millennial demographics. The tools it's building are meant to guide those specific populations to more resources to help them register to vote and form a voting plan. Other platforms focusing on voter registration are doing so with a much wider user population in mind.
  Voter Registration ‘Mini’: Snapchat announced at its Partner Summit earlier this year a new feature that allows outside developers to build utilities directly into Snapchat. The new "Voter Registration Mini" allows users to register to vote directly in Snapchat. It will also include a tracker to monitor how many users have registered to vote on Snapchat.
 Voter Guide: Snapchat is launching a new "Voter Guide" that provides users with information about topics like voting by mail, ballot education and voter registration. The guide is available via keyword search and will feature resources by expert organizations like the NAACP, ACLU, BallotReady, DemocracyWorks, APIA Vote, I am a Voter, Vote Early Day, National Voter Registration Day and more.
 Before You Vote ‘Mini’: Snapchat is partnering with BallotReady to launch a new "Mini" feature that will help Snapchat users learn about different voting options (in-person, vote-by-mail, etc.) and will encourage them to make a plan to go vote.
 Voter Checklist: Snapchat is launching a new voter portal that will serve as a checklist that can help users register to vote and will live in each Snapchatter’s user profile.
 The big picture: Snapchat  successfully registered 450,000 people through its app during the 2018 midterms. Data released in May shows that 50% of those registered actually went out and cast ballots.
 What's next: The new tools will roll out in September, but Snapchat is announcing the tools Thursday on the 55th anniversary of the Voting Rights Act. Snapchat says it will also release new content within its content arm, Discover, that will help inform users about how to register to vote and turn out.

虽然有迹象表明，在特朗普违反规定的情况下，脸书将挺身而出--比如周三，脸书删除了总统发布的一段视频，在视频中，特朗普声称儿童“几乎不受”新冠肺炎的影响--但也有其他人表示，该公司正在屈服于右翼的批评声音。在Workplace最近的另一篇帖子中，一名高级工程师收集的内部证据显示，Facebook正在优待知名的保守派账户，以帮助他们从内容中删除事实核查。
作为回应，该公司取消了他的职位，并限制内部访问他引用的信息。根据BuzzFeed新闻看到的内部帖子，这名工程师周三被解雇。
随着内部紧张局势的加剧和士气处于低谷，一个致力于错误信息政策的内部Workplace小组对该公司如何处理事实核查内容的担忧激增。
上周五，在另一次全体会议上，员工们问扎克伯格，右翼出版物布莱巴特新闻(Breitbart News)在分享了一段宣传未经证实的治疗方法的视频后，如何才能继续成为Facebook新闻的合作伙伴，并表示口罩对于抗击这种新型冠状病毒是不必要的。这段视频在被从布莱巴特的页面上删除之前，在6个小时内就获得了1400万的点击量，尽管其他账号仍在分享它。
扎克伯格回避了这个问题，但确实指出，如果布莱巴特在90天内因发布错误信息而受到两次罢工，它可能会被从公司的新闻标签中删除。(Facebook新闻合作伙伴，包括BuzzFeed News和华盛顿邮报(The Washington Post)等数十种出版物，可以获得补偿，并在社交网络上的一个特别新闻选项卡中获得安置。)。
扎克伯格说：“这当然是他们因为错误信息而遭受的一次打击，但在过去的90天里，他们没有其他的打击。”“因此，根据我们现有的政策(顺便说一句，我认为这些政策在这方面总体上是相当合理的)，取消这些政策是没有意义的。”
但Facebook自己的一些员工收集的证据显示，布莱巴特-以及其他右翼媒体和人物，包括Turning Point USA创始人查理·柯克(Charlie Kirk)、特朗普的支持者钻石和希尔克(Diamond And Silk)，以及保守的视频制作非营利性组织普拉格大学(Prager University)-受到了特殊对待，帮助它避免了与公司政策的冲突。他们认为这是对右翼出版商和页面的优待模式的一部分，其中许多人声称社交网络对保守派有偏见。
Facebook发言人利兹·布尔乔瓦在一份声明中说：“我们尊重第三方事实核查人员对一条内容的评级。”当事实检查员应用评级时，我们会应用标签和降级。但我们有责任为惯犯管理我们的内部系统。我们对多个虚假评级适用额外的系统范围处罚，包括去货币化和无法做广告，除非我们确定这些评级中的一个或多个不值得承担额外的后果。&#34；
7月22日，Facebook的一名员工向公司内部错误信息政策小组发布了一条消息，指出Facebook似乎代表该出版物行事的人已经澄清了针对布莱巴特的一些错误信息攻击。
这位员工写道：“布莱巴特升级标记为‘紧急：当天结束’的事件在同一天得到解决，所有针对布莱巴特页面和他们域名的错误信息罢工都在没有任何解释的情况下被清除。”
这名员工表示，该公司负责全球公共政策的副总裁乔尔·卡普兰(Joel Kaplan)表示，对查理·柯克(Charlie Kirk)在Instagram上发布的一篇帖子的部分错误评级被标记为“优先”升级。卡普兰曾在乔治·W·布什(George W.Bush)政府任职，并因公开支持布雷特·卡瓦诺(Brett Kavanaugh)有争议的最高法院提名而招致批评。
PolitiFact的执行董事亚伦·沙洛克曼(Aaron Sharockman)告诉BuzzFeed新闻，Facebook的一名联系人确实打电话讨论了柯克的帖子。
沙洛克曼说：“我们和他们通了电话，他们想知道这个帖子是如何与这个项目相一致的。”这只是一个微小的不准确，还是我们认为有潜在有害影响的东西？
PolitiFact没有改变对这篇帖子的评级。“我们坚持己见，”沙洛克曼说。
Facebook过去的员工，包括Facebook前全球选举广告诚信主管雅尔·艾森斯塔特(Yaël Eisenstat)，都对卡普兰对内容执法决定的影响力表示担忧。她之前告诉BuzzFeed新闻，卡普兰华盛顿政策团队的一名成员试图影响一个保守组织发布的广告的广告执行决定。
Facebook没有回应为什么卡普兰会亲自干预这样的事情的问题。
这些干预和其他干预似乎违反了Facebook的官方政策，该政策要求希望对事实核查评级提出异议的出版商与Facebook负责的事实核查合作伙伴联系。
另一名员工在该公司内部的“错误信息政策”讨论组中写道：“政策人员似乎一直在代表*完全*右翼出版商干预事实核查，以避免他们再次犯规。”
公开表示对右翼页面明显特殊对待的个人也面临后果。在一个案例中，Facebook的一名高级工程师收集了多个保守派人物从Facebook员工(包括政策团队中的员工)那里获得独特帮助的例子，以消除对其内容的事实核查。他7月份的帖子被删除了，因为这违反了公司的“尊重沟通政策”。
根据Workplace另一名员工的帖子，在这名工程师的职位被解除后，他引用的相关内部“任务”作为所谓的特殊待遇的例子，被设置为私人的，员工无法访问。
“就我个人而言，这让我对这家公司感到愤怒和羞愧，”这名员工写道，以支持他们的同事。
这位工程师于2016年加入公司，最近在Instagram上工作。他于周三离开了公司。BuzzFeed新闻看到的一名内部帖子上的一名员工说，他们得到了工程师的许可，可以说解雇“不是自愿的”。
在被解雇前的一篇内部帖子中，这位工程师表示，他“被告知，如果我的帖子被发现违反了尊重员工之外的其他政策，法律和人力资源部将与他联系。”
Facebook否认这名员工已经被解雇，但表示这是因为他们违反了公司的规定。
“我们有一种开放的文化，鼓励员工畅所欲言，”布尔乔瓦说。
他被解雇的消息导致Facebook的一些员工表示，他们现在害怕在内部讨论中批评公司。一人表示，他们正在删除旧帖子和评论，而另一人则表示，这“并不是第一次用尊重的工作场所指导方针来狙击一位著名的公司政策/道德批评者。”
另一名员工表示：“(他)是这家公司的良知，是我们做正确事情的不知疲倦的代言人。”
这名被解雇的员工拒绝置评，并要求不具名，因为担心引起反响。
2019年9月，Facebook创始人兼首席执行官马克·扎克伯格和Facebook全球公共政策副总裁乔尔·卡普兰在离开国会山与参议员约翰·科宁的会议后聊天。
这位工程师收集的内部证据与一名为Facebook的一家美国事实核查合作伙伴工作的记者的经验一致。他们告诉BuzzFeed新闻，保守的页面经常直接向公司抱怨。
“不按程序办事的出版商，似乎多是右翼的。他们没有向事实核查人员提出上诉，而是立即打电话给他们在Facebook的代表，“这位记者说。由于他们没有被授权公开发言，他拒绝透露姓名。“他们直接跳起来，说‘审查制度，第一修正案，自由。’”
他们补充说：“我认为Facebook有点害怕他们，因为特朗普政府。”
Facebook通常会将专门的合作伙伴经理指派到追随者较多或广告预算较大的页面。他们帮助客户最大限度地利用该平台。但在工程师的帖子中确定的案例中，合作伙伴代表似乎寻求对右翼出版商的优惠待遇。这导致了Facebook人员给事实核查合作伙伴打电话，以及在事实核查人员不知情或没有参与的情况下，错误信息罢工似乎已从内容中删除的情况。
Facebook的一名员工在7月22日的帖子中重申了这位工程师的发现，发现了多起来自右翼页面的事实核查投诉升级的情况，在某些情况下，投诉在同一天得到了有利于该账户的解决。
根据这篇帖子，乔尔·卡普兰(Joel Kaplan)在Instagram上对查理·柯克(Charlie Kirk)的一篇帖子进行了事实核查，要求“尽快/在下午12点之前”解决。ET“。这名员工声称，PragerU的合作伙伴经理是一项“为期两周的努力”的一部分，目的是防止该网站被授予惯犯身份，而这一称号将限制其覆盖范围和广告特权。
该代表以“合作伙伴敏感性”为例指出，PragerU投放了大量广告，并辩称相关内容符合观点，因此不受事实核查。
Facebook没有回答为什么合作伙伴经理会以广告量为理由不对一组页面采取行动。
沙洛克曼说，PolitiFact在Facebook的联系人从未要求他们改变评级。但Facebook的代表确实会主动讨论一篇帖子是否属于观点，是否超出了该计划的范围。
“我们进行了讨论，我们的合作伙伴问我们，‘你们为什么要对此进行事实核查？你为什么会得出这个结论呢？你认为这是否符合Facebook在事实核查方面的规章制度？他说。
布尔乔瓦说：我们有时会联系事实核查人员，以澄清我们的指导方针和该计划的范围。
马克·普罗沃斯特管理着多个不断进步的大型Facebook页面，包括其他98%的页面，这是该平台上最大的页面之一。他说，他的Facebook合作伙伴经理的反应远远低于Facebook员工为右边的Provost同行记录的内容。他也不知道Facebook曾代表他联系过任何事实核查人员。
普罗沃斯特在谈到脸书时说：“我们10天内都不会收到回信。”“我想右翼得到了一笔更好的交易。”
他的另一个98%的页面目前有被删除的风险，因为它有三次罢工。教务长说，其中一次罢工是因为三个月前违反了仇恨言论，尽管到目前为止，Facebook还没有人告诉他这篇冒犯的帖子是什么。据教务长称，他的合作伙伴代表表示，他们将对此进行调查。那是上周的事了，他说他还没有收到最新消息。
“我对此感到非常沮丧，”教务长说。“最好的解决方案是，如果Facebook像他们指派的事实核查公司一样做出反应。”
普罗沃斯特说，当他联系Facebook的事实核查伙伴对评级提出异议时，很容易与他们打交道。在某些情况下，他提供了额外的证据，证明他声称自己改变了评级；在另一些情况下，他纠正了违规帖子，错误的评级被删除。
接受BuzzFeed新闻采访的事实核查人员表示，大多数页面所有者都遵循这项政策，并与他们联系，对评级提出异议。但在某些情况下，他们会直接听取被指派与事实核查人员合作的Facebook合作伙伴经理的意见。
“他们会问我们，‘你能再看看这个吗？你确定吗？‘“。收银员说。
在其他情况下，Facebook本身将悄悄地删除其合作伙伴之一应用的事实核查。这似乎就是3月25日钻石与丝绸(Diamond And Silk)的一篇帖子所发生的事情。两人在Facebook上写道：“该死的，为了给众议院议员加薪，怎么会拨出2500万美元，一点也不关心美国人，这将有助于刺激美国的经济？”告诉我怎么做？#PutamericansBackToWorkNow。“
Facebook的事实核查合作伙伴Lead Stories将这篇帖子评为虚假。戴蒙德和西尔克最初遵循了适当的程序，直接呼吁进行头条新闻。
《头条》主编艾伦·杜克(Alan Duke)告诉BuzzFeed新闻：“他们的呼吁很详细，我们很快就做出了回应。”“结果是，我们决定，最初给出内容的虚假评级应该向下修正为‘部分虚假’。”
但这一部分虚假的评级显然并不能让戴蒙德和西尔克满意，据报道，他们在传播冠状病毒错误信息后失去了在线福克斯新闻节目。正如7月22日Facebook内部帖子所述，戴蒙德和西尔克呼吁他们的合作伙伴经理，后者为这一问题开了一张内部罚单。Facebook的代表辩称，这篇帖子只是观点，并警告说，这两人“非常敏感，毫不犹豫地公开了他们对Facebook上所谓的保守派偏见的担忧。”
这位Facebook员工说，“有人在任务中被描述为‘政策/领导层’，他呼吁不仅要完全取消这次罢工，还要取消从1月份开始的罢工。”
note_en:
After months of debate and disagreement over the handling of inflammatory or misleading posts from Donald Trump, Facebook employees want CEO Mark Zuckerberg to explain what the company would do if the leader of the free world uses the social network to undermine the results of the 2020 US presidential election.
 “I do think we’re headed for a problematic scenario where Facebook is going to be used to aggressively undermine the legitimacy of the US elections, in a way that has never been possible in history,” one Facebook employee wrote in a group on Workplace, the company’s internal communication platform, earlier this week.
 For the past week, this scenario has been a topic of heated discussion inside Facebook and is now a top question for its leader. Some 2,900 employees asked that Zuckerberg address it publicly during a company-wide meeting on Thursday which is slated for 11 a.m. PT.
 Zuckerberg’s expected remarks come amid  growing internal concerns about the company's competence in handling misinformation, and the precautions it is taking to ensure its platform isn’t used to disrupt or mislead ahead of the US presidential election. Though Facebook says it has committed more money and resources to avoid repeating its failures during the 2016 election, some employees believe it isn’t enough. President Trump has already spent months raising questions about the legitimacy of the upcoming 2020 election,  spreading misinformation about mail-in ballots, and declining to say if he’d accept the possibility of losing to Democratic nominee Joe Biden in November.
 In July,  Trump told Fox News he wasn’t sure if he’d concede to Biden, casting doubt on whether there would be a peaceful transition of power if the former vice president wins the election. "I have to see. I'm not just going to say yes. I'm not going to say no," the president said.
    On Facebook’s internal message boards, discussion about the Trump election question remained civil prior to Thursday’s all-hands meeting. Employees debated the merits of censoring a sitting president’s potentially false statements about election results with one person noting that “it would be a really troubling policy to apply globally.”
 "America can't afford for Facebook to take a wait-and-see approach when it comes to the integrity of our democracy,” said Jesse Lehrich, a former foreign policy spokesperson to Hillary Clinton and cofounder of Accountable Tech, a nonprofit advocacy group. “Unless they proactively outline clear policies and enforcement mechanisms to safeguard the election, the platform  will be weaponized to undermine it."
 Do you work at Facebook or another technology company? We'd love to hear from you. Reach out at  craig.silverman@buzzfeed.com,   ryan.mac@buzzfeed.com,  or  via one of our   tip line channels .
 While there are signs Facebook will stand up to Trump in cases where he violates its rules — as on Wednesday when  it removed a video post from the president in which he claimed that children are “almost immune” to  COVID-19 — there are others who suggest the company is caving to critical voices on the right. In another recent Workplace post, a senior engineer collected internal evidence that showed Facebook was giving preferential treatment to prominent conservative accounts to help them remove fact-checks from their content.
 The company responded by removing his post and restricting internal access to the information he cited. On Wednesday the engineer was fired, according to internal posts seen by BuzzFeed News.
  With  heightened internal tensions and morale at a low point, concerns about how the company handles fact-checked content have exploded in an internal Workplace group dedicated to misinformation policy.
 Last Friday, at another all-hands meeting, employees asked Zuckerberg how right-wing publication Breitbart News could remain a Facebook News partner after sharing a video that promoted unproven treatments and said masks were unnecessary to combat the novel coronavirus. The video racked up 14 million views in six hours  before it was removed from Breitbart’s page, though other accounts continued to share it.
 Zuckerberg danced around the question but did note that Breitbart could be removed from the company's news tab if it were to receive two strikes for publishing misinformation within 90 days of each other. (Facebook News partners, which include dozens of publications such as BuzzFeed News and the Washington Post, receive compensation and placement in a special news tab on the social network.)
 “This was certainly one strike against them for misinformation, but they don't have others in the last 90 days,” Zuckerberg said. “So by the policies that we have, which by the way I think are generally pretty reasonable on this, it doesn't make sense to remove them.”
 But some of Facebook’s own employees gathered evidence they say shows Breitbart — along with other right-wing outlets and figures including Turning Point USA founder Charlie Kirk, Trump supporters Diamond and Silk, and conservative video production nonprofit  Prager University — has received special treatment that helped it avoid running afoul of company policy. They see it as part of a pattern of preferential treatment for right-wing publishers and pages, many of which have alleged that the social network is biased against conservatives.
 “We defer to third-party fact-checkers on the rating that a piece of content receives," Facebook spokesperson Liz Bourgeois said in a statement. "When a fact checker applies a rating, we apply a label and demotion. But we are responsible for how we manage our internal systems for repeat offenders. We apply additional system wide penalties for multiple false ratings, including demonetization and the inability to advertise, unless we determine that one or more of those ratings does not warrant additional consequences."
 On July 22, a Facebook employee posted a message to the company’s internal misinformation policy group noting that some misinformation strikes against Breitbart had been cleared by someone at Facebook seemingly acting on the publication's behalf.
 “A Breitbart escalation marked ‘urgent: end of day’ was resolved on the same day, with all misinformation strikes against Breitbart’s page and against their domain cleared without explanation,” the employee wrote.
 The same employee said a partly false rating applied to an Instagram post from Charlie Kirk was flagged for “priority” escalation by Joel Kaplan, the company’s vice president of global public policy. Kaplan once served in George W. Bush’s administration and drew criticism for publicly supporting Brett Kavanaugh’s controversial nomination to the Supreme Court.
 Aaron Sharockman, the executive director of PolitiFact, told BuzzFeed News a contact at Facebook did call to discuss Kirk’s post.
 “We had a call with them where they wanted to know how this post was aligned with the program,” Sharockman said. "Was this just a minor inaccuracy or was it something that we thought was something that had potential harmful effects?"
 PolitiFact did not change its rating on the post. “We stuck to our guns there,” Sharockman said.
 Past Facebook employees, including Yaël Eisenstat, Facebook's former global election ads integrity lead, have expressed concerns with Kaplan’s influence over content enforcement decisions. She  previously told BuzzFeed News a member of Kaplan's Washington policy team attempted to influence ad enforcement decisions for an ad placed by a conservative organization.
 Facebook did not respond to questions about why Kaplan would personally intervene in matters like this.
    These and other interventions appear to be in violation of Facebook’s  official policy, which requires publishers wishing to dispute a fact check rating to contact the Facebook fact-checking partner responsible.
 “It appears that policy people have been intervening in fact-checks on behalf of *exclusively* right-wing publishers, to avoid them getting repeat-offender status,” wrote another employee in the company’s internal “misinformation policy” discussion group.
 Individuals that spoke out about the apparent special treatment of right-wing pages have also faced consequences. In one case, a senior Facebook engineer collected multiple instances of conservative figures receiving unique help from Facebook employees, including those on the policy team, to remove fact-checks on their content. His July post was removed because it violated the company’s “respectful communication policy.”
 After the engineer’s post was removed, the related internal “tasks” he’d cited as examples of the alleged special treatment were made private and inaccessible to employees, according to a Workplace post from another employee.
 “Personally this makes me so angry and ashamed of this company,” wrote the employee in support of their colleague.
 The engineer joined the company in 2016 and most recently worked on Instagram. He left the company on Wednesday. One employee on an internal thread seen by BuzzFeed News said that they received permission from the engineer to say that the dismissal “was not voluntary.”
 In an internal post before his dismissal, the engineer said he was “told to expect to be contacted by legal and HR if my post is found to be violating other policies in addition to Respectful Comms.”
 Facebook denied the employee had been terminated for the post but said it was because "they broke the company's rules."
 “We have an open culture and encourage employees to speak out about concerns they have," Bourgeois said.
 News of his firing caused some Facebook employees to say that they now fear speaking critically about the company in internal discussions. One person said they were deleting old posts and comments, while another said this was “hardly the first time the respectful workplace guidelines have been used to snipe a prominent critic of company policies/ethics.”
 “[He] was a conscience of this company, and a tireless voice for us doing the right thing,” said another employee.
 The terminated employee declined to comment and asked not to be named for fear of repercussions.
  Facebook founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook's Vice President of Global Public Policy Joel Kaplan chat after leaving a meeting with Sen. John Cornyn on Capitol Hill in September 2019.
  The internal evidence gathered by the engineer aligns with the experience of a journalist who works for one of Facebook’s US fact-checking partners. They told BuzzFeed News that conservative pages often complain directly to the company.
 “Of the publishers that don’t follow the procedure, it seems to be mostly ones on the right. Instead of appealing to the fact-checker they immediately call their rep at Facebook,” said the journalist, who declined to be named because they were not authorized to speak publicly. “They jump straight up and say ‘censorship, First Amendment, freedom.’”
 “I think Facebook is a bit afraid of them because of the Trump administration,” they added.
    Facebook typically assigns dedicated partner managers to pages with large followings or big ad budgets. They help their clients maximize their use of the platform. But in the cases identified in the engineer's post, partner reps appear to have sought preferential treatment for right-wing publishers. This resulted in phone calls to fact-checking partners from people at Facebook, and instances where misinformation strikes appear to have been removed from content without a fact-checker’s knowledge or involvement.
 A Facebook employee’s July 22 post restating the engineer’s findings identified multiple cases in which a fact-check complaint from a right-wing page was escalated and in some cases resolved in the account’s favor the same day.
 According to the post, Joel Kaplan flagged a fact check of a Charlie Kirk Instagram post for resolution “ASAP/before 12 p.m. ET”. This same employee claimed PragerU's partner manager was part of a “two weeks long effort” to prevent the site from being given Repeat Offender status, a designation that would have limited its reach and advertising privileges.
 Citing “partner sensitivity," the rep noted that PragerU runs a lot of ads, and argued that the content in question qualified as opinion and was therefore exempt from being fact-checked.
 Facebook did not answer questions about why a partner manager would cite ad volume as a reason for not acting against a group of pages.
 Sharockman said PolitiFact’s contacts at Facebook have never asked them to change a rating. But Facebook reps do reach out to discuss whether a post is opinion or otherwise outside of the scope of the program.
 “We have had discussions where our partners have asked us, ‘Why did you fact check this? Why did you come to this conclusion? How do you think it fits within the scope of Facebook's rules or regulations within fact-checking?’” he said.
 "We sometimes reach out to fact-checkers to clarify our guidelines and scope of the program," Bourgeois said.
 Mark Provost manages multiple large progressive Facebook pages, including The Other 98%, one of the biggest on the platform. He said his Facebook partner manager is far less responsive than what the Facebook employee documented for Provost’s counterparts on the right. And he’s not aware of any case where Facebook contacted a fact-checker on his behalf.
 “We don't get a message back for 10 days,” Provost said of Facebook. “I imagine the right wing is getting a way better deal.”
 His Other 98% page is currently at risk of deletion because it has three strikes. Provost said one strike is for a hate speech violation three months ago, though as of now no one at Facebook has told him what the offending post was. His partner representative said they would look into it, according to Provost. That was last week and he says he still hasn’t received an update.
 “I'm getting so frustrated with this,” Provost said. “The best solution would be if Facebook were as responsive as the fact-checking companies that they've assigned.”
 Provost said Facebook’s fact-checking partners are easy to deal with when he contacts them to dispute a rating. In some cases, he provided additional proof of his claim to get a rating changed; in other cases, he corrected the offending post and the false rating was removed.
 The fact-checker who spoke to BuzzFeed News said most page owners follow the policy and contact them to dispute a rating. But in some cases, they hear directly from the Facebook partner manager assigned to work with fact-checkers.
 “They will ask us, ‘Could you take a look at this again? Are you sure?’” the checker said.
 In other cases, Facebook itself will quietly remove a fact-check applied by one of its partners. That appears to be what happened with a March 25 post from Diamond and Silk. The duo  wrote on Facebook, “How the hell is allocating 25 million dollars in order to give a raise to house members, that don't give a damn about Americans, going to help stimulate America's economy? Tell me how? #PutAmericansBackToWorkNow.”
 Lead Stories, a Facebook fact-checking partner, rated the post false. Diamond and Silk initially followed the proper procedure and appealed directly to Lead Stories.
 “They were detailed in their appeal and we replied promptly,” Alan Duke, the editor-in-chief of Lead Stories, told BuzzFeed News. “The result was that we decided that a false rating initially given their content should be revised downward to ‘partly false.’”
 But that partly false rating apparently didn’t satisfy Diamond and Silk, who  reportedly lost their online Fox News show after spreading coronavirus misinformation. As detailed in the July 22 internal Facebook post, Diamond and Silk appealed to their partner manager, who opened an internal ticket for the issue. The Facebook rep argued the post was opinion and warned that the duo “is extremely sensitive and has not hesitated going public about their concerns around alleged conservative bias on Facebook.”
 The Facebook employee said that “someone described on the task as ‘Policy/Leadership’ made the call to not only completely remove this strike, but also the one from January.” ●
title: 工作人员询问扎克伯格，如果特朗普利用Facebook对选举提出异议，会发生什么；一些工作人员表示，他们有证据表明他们偏袒右翼页面
title_en: Staffers ask Zuckerberg what would happen if Trump uses Facebook to dispute the election; some staff say they have evidence of favoritism for right-wing pages

note:
在对唐纳德·特朗普(Donald Trump)煽动性或误导性帖子的处理方式进行了数月的辩论和分歧后，Facebook员工希望首席执行官马克·扎克伯格(Mark Zuckerberg)解释说，如果这位自由世界的领导人利用这个社交网络破坏2020年美国总统大选的结果，公司会怎么做。
Facebook的一名员工本周早些时候在该公司内部沟通平台Workplace的一个群组中写道：“我确实认为，我们正走向一个有问题的场景，Facebook将被用来以历史上从未有过的方式，积极破坏美国选举的合法性。”
在过去的一周里，这种情况一直是Facebook内部激烈讨论的话题，现在也是其领导人的首要问题。约2900名员工要求扎克伯格在周四上午11点举行的全公司会议上公开发表讲话。PT.。
扎克伯格意料之中的讲话正值内部对该公司处理错误信息的能力日益担忧之际，以及该公司为确保其平台不会在美国总统大选前被用来扰乱或误导而采取的预防措施。尽管Facebook表示，它已经投入了更多的资金和资源，以避免在2016年大选期间重蹈覆辙，但一些员工认为这还不够。特朗普总统已经花了几个月的时间质疑即将到来的2020年大选的合法性，散布关于邮寄选票的错误信息，并拒绝透露他是否接受在11月输给民主党候选人乔·拜登的可能性。
今年7月，特朗普告诉福克斯新闻(Fox News)，他不确定自己是否会向拜登让步，这让人怀疑，如果这位前副总统赢得选举，权力是否会和平过渡。我得看看。我不会简单地说“是”。我不会说不，总统说。
在Facebook的内部留言板上，在周四的全体会议之前，关于特朗普选举问题的讨论仍然是文明的。员工们就审查在任总统关于选举结果的潜在虚假陈述的好处展开了辩论，其中一人指出，“这将是一项真正令人不安的政策，适用于全球。”
美国不能让Facebook在谈到我们民主的完整性时采取观望态度，“希拉里·克林顿(Hillary Clinton)的前外交政策发言人、非营利性倡导组织Responsible Tech的联合创始人杰西·莱里奇(Jesse Lehrich)说。“除非他们主动勾勒出明确的政策和执行机制来保障选举，否则政纲将被武器化，以破坏它。
你在Facebook或其他科技公司工作吗？我们很高兴收到你的来信。联系Craig.silverman@buzzfeed.com，ryan.mac@buzzfeed.com，或通过我们的举报热线渠道之一。
虽然有迹象表明，在特朗普违反规定的情况下，脸书将挺身而出--比如周三，脸书删除了总统发布的一段视频，在视频中，特朗普声称儿童“几乎不受”新冠肺炎的影响--但也有其他人表示，该公司正在屈服于右翼的批评声音。在Workplace最近的另一篇帖子中，一名高级工程师收集的内部证据显示，Facebook正在优待知名的保守派账户，以帮助他们从内容中删除事实核查。
作为回应，该公司取消了他的职位，并限制内部访问他引用的信息。根据BuzzFeed新闻看到的内部帖子，这名工程师周三被解雇。
随着内部紧张局势的加剧和士气处于低谷，一个致力于错误信息政策的内部Workplace小组对该公司如何处理事实核查内容的担忧激增。
上周五，在另一次全体会议上，员工们问扎克伯格，右翼出版物布莱巴特新闻(Breitbart News)在分享了一段宣传未经证实的治疗方法的视频后，如何才能继续成为Facebook新闻的合作伙伴，并表示口罩对于抗击这种新型冠状病毒是不必要的。这段视频在被从布莱巴特的页面上删除之前，在6个小时内就获得了1400万的点击量，尽管其他账号仍在分享它。
扎克伯格回避了这个问题，但确实指出，如果布莱巴特在90天内因发布错误信息而受到两次罢工，它可能会被从公司的新闻标签中删除。(Facebook新闻合作伙伴，包括BuzzFeed News和华盛顿邮报(The Washington Post)等数十种出版物，可以获得补偿，并在社交网络上的一个特别新闻选项卡中获得安置。)。
扎克伯格说：“这当然是他们因为错误信息而遭受的一次打击，但在过去的90天里，他们没有其他的打击。”“因此，根据我们现有的政策(顺便说一句，我认为这些政策在这方面总体上是相当合理的)，取消这些政策是没有意义的。”
但Facebook自己的一些员工收集的证据显示，布莱巴特-以及其他右翼媒体和人物，包括Turning Point USA创始人查理·柯克(Charlie Kirk)、特朗普的支持者钻石和希尔克(Diamond And Silk)，以及保守的视频制作非营利性组织普拉格大学(Prager University)-受到了特殊对待，帮助它避免了与公司政策的冲突。他们认为这是对右翼出版商和页面的优待模式的一部分，其中许多人声称社交网络对保守派有偏见。
Facebook发言人利兹·布尔乔瓦在一份声明中说：“我们尊重第三方事实核查人员对一条内容的评级。”当事实检查员应用评级时，我们会应用标签和降级。但我们有责任为惯犯管理我们的内部系统。我们对多个虚假评级适用额外的系统范围处罚，包括去货币化和无法做广告，除非我们确定这些评级中的一个或多个不值得承担额外的后果。&#34；
7月22日，Facebook的一名员工向公司内部错误信息政策小组发布了一条消息，指出Facebook似乎代表该出版物行事的人已经澄清了针对布莱巴特的一些错误信息攻击。
这位员工写道：“布莱巴特升级标记为‘紧急：当天结束’的事件在同一天得到解决，所有针对布莱巴特页面和他们域名的错误信息罢工都在没有任何解释的情况下被清除。”
这名员工表示，该公司负责全球公共政策的副总裁乔尔·卡普兰(Joel Kaplan)表示，对查理·柯克(Charlie Kirk)在Instagram上发布的一篇帖子的部分错误评级被标记为“优先”升级。卡普兰曾在乔治·W·布什(George W.Bush)政府任职，并因公开支持布雷特·卡瓦诺(Brett Kavanaugh)有争议的最高法院提名而招致批评。
PolitiFact的执行董事亚伦·沙洛克曼(Aaron Sharockman)告诉BuzzFeed新闻，Facebook的一名联系人确实打电话讨论了柯克的帖子。
沙洛克曼说：“我们和他们通了电话，他们想知道这个帖子是如何与这个项目相一致的。”这只是一个微小的不准确，还是我们认为有潜在有害影响的东西？
PolitiFact没有改变对这篇帖子的评级。“我们坚持己见，”沙洛克曼说。
Facebook过去的员工，包括Facebook前全球选举广告诚信主管雅尔·艾森斯塔特(Yaël Eisenstat)，都对卡普兰对内容执法决定的影响力表示担忧。她之前告诉BuzzFeed新闻，卡普兰华盛顿政策团队的一名成员试图影响一个保守组织发布的广告的广告执行决定。
Facebook没有回应为什么卡普兰会亲自干预这样的事情的问题。
这些干预和其他干预似乎违反了Facebook的官方政策，该政策要求希望对事实核查评级提出异议的出版商与Facebook负责的事实核查合作伙伴联系。
另一名员工在该公司内部的“错误信息政策”讨论组中写道：“政策人员似乎一直在代表*完全*右翼出版商干预事实核查，以避免他们再次犯规。”
公开表示对右翼页面明显特殊对待的个人也面临后果。在一个案例中，Facebook的一名高级工程师收集了多个保守派人物从Facebook员工(包括政策团队中的员工)那里获得独特帮助的例子，以消除对其内容的事实核查。他7月份的帖子被删除了，因为这违反了公司的“尊重沟通政策”。
根据Workplace另一名员工的帖子，在这名工程师的职位被解除后，他引用的相关内部“任务”作为所谓的特殊待遇的例子，被设置为私人的，员工无法访问。
“就我个人而言，这让我对这家公司感到愤怒和羞愧，”这名员工写道，以支持他们的同事。
这位工程师于2016年加入公司，最近在Instagram上工作。他于周三离开了公司。BuzzFeed新闻看到的一名内部帖子上的一名员工说，他们得到了工程师的许可，可以说解雇“不是自愿的”。
在被解雇前的一篇内部帖子中，这位工程师表示，他“被告知，如果我的帖子被发现违反了尊重员工之外的其他政策，法律和人力资源部将与他联系。”
Facebook否认这名员工已经被解雇，但表示这是因为他们违反了公司的规定。
“我们有一种开放的文化，鼓励员工畅所欲言，”布尔乔瓦说。
他被解雇的消息导致Facebook的一些员工表示，他们现在害怕在内部讨论中批评公司。一人表示，他们正在删除旧帖子和评论，而另一人则表示，这“并不是第一次用尊重的工作场所指导方针来狙击一位著名的公司政策/道德批评者。”
另一名员工表示：“(他)是这家公司的良知，是我们做正确事情的不知疲倦的代言人。”
这名被解雇的员工拒绝置评，并要求不具名，因为担心引起反响。
2019年9月，Facebook创始人兼首席执行官马克·扎克伯格和Facebook全球公共政策副总裁乔尔·卡普兰在离开国会山与参议员约翰·科宁的会议后聊天。
这位工程师收集的内部证据与一名为Facebook的一家美国事实核查合作伙伴工作的记者的经验一致。他们告诉BuzzFeed新闻，保守的页面经常直接向公司抱怨。
“不按程序办事的出版商，似乎多是右翼的。他们没有向事实核查人员提出上诉，而是立即打电话给他们在Facebook的代表，“这位记者说。由于他们没有被授权公开发言，他拒绝透露姓名。“他们直接跳起来，说‘审查制度，第一修正案，自由。’”
他们补充说：“我认为Facebook有点害怕他们，因为特朗普政府。”
Facebook通常会将专门的合作伙伴经理指派到追随者较多或广告预算较大的页面。他们帮助客户最大限度地利用该平台。但在工程师的帖子中确定的案例中，合作伙伴代表似乎寻求对右翼出版商的优惠待遇。这导致了Facebook人员给事实核查合作伙伴打电话，以及在事实核查人员不知情或没有参与的情况下，错误信息罢工似乎已从内容中删除的情况。
Facebook的一名员工在7月22日的帖子中重申了这位工程师的发现，发现了多起来自右翼页面的事实核查投诉升级的情况，在某些情况下，投诉在同一天得到了有利于该账户的解决。
根据这篇帖子，乔尔·卡普兰(Joel Kaplan)在Instagram上对查理·柯克(Charlie Kirk)的一篇帖子进行了事实核查，要求“尽快/在下午12点之前”解决。ET“。这名员工声称，PragerU的合作伙伴经理是一项“为期两周的努力”的一部分，目的是防止该网站被授予惯犯身份，而这一称号将限制其覆盖范围和广告特权。
该代表以“合作伙伴敏感性”为例指出，PragerU投放了大量广告，并辩称相关内容符合观点，因此不受事实核查。
Facebook没有回答为什么合作伙伴经理会以广告量为理由不对一组页面采取行动。
沙洛克曼说，PolitiFact在Facebook的联系人从未要求他们改变评级。但Facebook的代表确实会主动讨论一篇帖子是否属于观点，是否超出了该计划的范围。
“我们进行了讨论，我们的合作伙伴问我们，‘你们为什么要对此进行事实核查？你为什么会得出这个结论呢？你认为这是否符合Facebook在事实核查方面的规章制度？他说。
布尔乔瓦说：我们有时会联系事实核查人员，以澄清我们的指导方针和该计划的范围。
马克·普罗沃斯特管理着多个不断进步的大型Facebook页面，包括其他98%的页面，这是该平台上最大的页面之一。他说，他的Facebook合作伙伴经理的反应远远低于Facebook员工为右边的Provost同行记录的内容。他也不知道Facebook曾代表他联系过任何事实核查人员。
普罗沃斯特在谈到脸书时说：“我们10天内都不会收到回信。”“我想右翼得到了一笔更好的交易。”
他的另一个98%的页面目前有被删除的风险，因为它有三次罢工。教务长说，其中一次罢工是因为三个月前违反了仇恨言论，尽管到目前为止，Facebook还没有人告诉他这篇冒犯的帖子是什么。据教务长称，他的合作伙伴代表表示，他们将对此进行调查。那是上周的事了，他说他还没有收到最新消息。
“我对此感到非常沮丧，”教务长说。“最好的解决方案是，如果Facebook像他们指派的事实核查公司一样做出反应。”
普罗沃斯特说，当他联系Facebook的事实核查伙伴对评级提出异议时，很容易与他们打交道。在某些情况下，他提供了额外的证据，证明他声称自己改变了评级；在另一些情况下，他纠正了违规帖子，错误的评级被删除。
接受BuzzFeed新闻采访的事实核查人员表示，大多数页面所有者都遵循这项政策，并与他们联系，对评级提出异议。但在某些情况下，他们会直接听取被指派与事实核查人员合作的Facebook合作伙伴经理的意见。
“他们会问我们，‘你能再看看这个吗？你确定吗？‘“。收银员说。
在其他情况下，Facebook本身将悄悄地删除其合作伙伴之一应用的事实核查。这似乎就是3月25日钻石与丝绸(Diamond And Silk)的一篇帖子所发生的事情。两人在Facebook上写道：“该死的，为了给众议院议员加薪，怎么会拨出2500万美元，一点也不关心美国人，这将有助于刺激美国的经济？”告诉我怎么做？#PutamericansBackToWorkNow。“
Facebook的事实核查合作伙伴Lead Stories将这篇帖子评为虚假。戴蒙德和西尔克最初遵循了适当的程序，直接呼吁进行头条新闻。
《头条》主编艾伦·杜克(Alan Duke)告诉BuzzFeed新闻：“他们的呼吁很详细，我们很快就做出了回应。”“结果是，我们决定，最初给出内容的虚假评级应该向下修正为‘部分虚假’。”
但这一部分虚假的评级显然并不能让戴蒙德和西尔克满意，据报道，他们在传播冠状病毒错误信息后失去了在线福克斯新闻节目。正如7月22日Facebook内部帖子所述，戴蒙德和西尔克呼吁他们的合作伙伴经理，后者为这一问题开了一张内部罚单。Facebook的代表辩称，这篇帖子只是观点，并警告说，这两人“非常敏感，毫不犹豫地公开了他们对Facebook上所谓的保守派偏见的担忧。”
这位Facebook员工说，“有人在任务中被描述为‘政策/领导层’，他呼吁不仅要完全取消这次罢工，还要取消从1月份开始的罢工。”
